translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Incumbent it is upon me that I speak naught respecting Allah save the truth; surely I have brought you an evidence from your Lord; wherefore let then go with me the Children of Isra'il.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Proper it is for me that I say nothing concerning Allah but the truth. Indeed I have come unto you from your Lord with a clear proof. So let the Children of Israel depart along with me."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “It is only proper that I should not say about God anything other than the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with me.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And it behoves me to say nothing about Allah except what is true. I have come to you with a clear sign of having been sent from your Lord. So let the Children of Israel go with me.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Proper it is for me that I say nothing concerning Allah but the truth. Indeed I have come unto you from your Lord with a clear proof. So let the Children of Israel depart along with me."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Approved upon condition that I speak concerning Allah nothing but the truth. I come unto you (lords of Egypt) with a clear proof from your Lord. So let the Children of Israel go with me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It behooves me to say nothing about Allah except the truth. I certainly bring you a manifest proof from your Lord. So let the Children of Israel go with me.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: incumbent upon me is that I say nothing of Allah except the truth. I bring you a clear proof from your Lord. So let the Children of Israel depart with me'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Who is] obligated not to say about Allah except the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so send with me the Children of Israel."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: I must only speak what is true about God. I have brought you miracles from your Lord; therefore, let the children of Israel go free".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: (I am) worthy of not saying anything about Allah except the truth: I have come to you indeed with clear proof from your Lord, therefore send with me the children of Israel

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Haqeequn AAala an la aqoola AAala Allahi illa alhaqqa qad jitukum bibayyinatin min rabbikum faarsil maAAiya banee israeela

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: duty-bound to say nothing about God but the truth, and I have brought you a clear sign from your Lord. Let the Children of Israel go with me."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: One for whom it is right to say nothing but truth about Allah. Now have I come unto you (people), from your Lord, with a clear (Sign): So let the Children of Israel depart along with me."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ إِنْ‌ کُنْتَ‌ جِئْتَ‌ بِآيَةٍ فَأْتِ‌ بِهَا إِنْ‌ کُنْتَ‌ مِنَ‌ الصَّادِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [فرعون] گفت: اگر [در ادعای پیامبری] از راستگویانی چنانچه معجزه ای آورده ای آن را ارائه کن.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اگر راست مى‌گويى و معجزه‌اى به همراه دارى، آن را بياور.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: اگر راست مى‌گويى و معجزه‌اى آورده‌اى، آن را بياور

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [فرعون‌] گفت: «اگر معجزه‌اى آورده‌اى، پس اگر راست مى‌گويى آن را ارائه بده.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: فرعون پاسخ داد که اگر دلیلی برای صدق خود داری بیار اگر از راستگویانی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: فرعون گفت: اگر معجزه‌ی بزرگ و دلیل سترگی با خود داری، آن را بنمای، اگر از زمره‌ی راستگویانی (و خویشتن را پیغمبر خدا می‌دانی).

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت اگر راست می‌گویی که معجزه‌ای آورده‌ای آن را [به میان‌] بیاور

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (فرعون) گفت: «اگر نشانه‌ای آورده‌ای، نشان بده اگر از راستگویانی!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت اگر آیتی آورده‌ای پس بیارش اگر هستی از راستگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [فرعون‌] گفت: اگر تو با نشانه‌اى آمده‌اى آن را بيار، اگر از راستگويانى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (فرعون) گفت: «اگر تو نشانه‌ای آورده بوده‌ای - اگر از راستان بوده‌ای - پس آن را (با خود) بیاور.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He said: "If you have brought a sign then display it, if what you say is true."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Firaun, “If you have come with a sign, then present it if you are truthful!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'If thou hast brought a sign, produce it, if thou speakest truly.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: if thou hast brought a sign, forth with it then, if thou art of the truth-tellers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "If you have come with a sign, show it forth, - if you are one of those who tell the truth."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “If you brought a miracle, then present it, if you are truthful.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Pharaoh said: if you have brought a sign, then bring it forth if you are truthful.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: [Fir`awn] said: "If you have come with a sign, show it forth, if you are one of those who tell the truth."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (Pharaoh) said: If thou comest with a token, then produce it, if thou art of those who speak the truth.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘If you have brought a sign, produce it, should you be truthful.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He answered: 'If you have come with a sign, show it to us if you are of the truthful'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Pharaoh] said, "If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you should be of the truthful."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Pharaoh asked Moses to show his miracles if he was telling the truth.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: If you have come with a sign, then bring it, if you are of the truthful ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala in kunta jita biayatin fati biha in kunta mina alssadiqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: [Pharaoh] said, "If you come with a sign, then produce it, if you are telling the truth."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Pharaoh) said: "If indeed thou hast come with a Sign, show it forth,- if thou tellest the truth."

verses.text: فَأَلْقَى‌ عَصَاهُ‌ فَإِذَا هِيَ‌ ثُعْبَانٌ‌ مُبِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس موسی عصایش را انداخت، پس به ناگاه اژدهایی آشکار شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: عصايش را انداخت، اژدهايى راستين شد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس عصاى خويش بيفكند كه در دم اژدهايى واقعى شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس [موسى‌] عصايش را افكند و بناگاه اژدهايى آشكار شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: موسی هم عصای خود را بیفکند به ناگاه آن عصا اژدهایی عظیم پدیدار گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس موسی فوراً عصای خود را بینداخت، به ناگاه به صورت اژدهای آشکاری درآمد (که از حیات کامل برخوردار بود و بدین سو و آن سو می‌خزید و می‌جهید). [[«ثُعْبَانٍ»: اژدها. مار بزرگ. «مُبِینٌ»: آشکار. علنی. مراد از ذکر این قید این است که سحر و تردستی و چشم‌بندی در میان نبود، بلکه عصا حقیقتاً به اژدهای زنده تبدیل شد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه عصایش را در انداخت و ناگهان به صورت اژدهایی آشکار درآمد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (موسی) عصای خود را افکند؛ ناگهان اژدهای آشکاری شد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بیفکند عصایش را ناگاه آن اژدهائی است آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس عصاى خود را بيفكند كه ناگاه اژدهايى هويدا شد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (موسی) عصایش را افکند. سپس به‌ناگاه اژدری آشکارگر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: At this Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it became a live serpent.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore Moosa put down his staff – it immediately turned into a visible python.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So he cast his staff; and behold, it was a serpent manifest.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Thereupon he cast down his rod, when, lo it was a serpent manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then [Musa (Moses)] threw his stick and behold! it was a serpent, manifest!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So he threw his staff, and it was an apparent serpent.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thereupon Moses threw his rod, and suddenly it was a veritable serpent.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then [Musa] threw his staff and behold! it was a [Thu`ban] serpent, manifest!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then he flung down his staff and lo! it was a serpent manifest;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thereat he threw down his staff, and behold, it became a manifest python.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He threw down his staff, and it was clearly a serpent.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So Moses threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent, manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: So Moses threw down his staff and suddenly it turned into a real serpent.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So he threw his rod, then lo! it was a clear serpent.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faalqa AAasahu faitha hiya thuAAbanun mubeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then Moses threw down his staff and suddenly, unmistakably, it appeared as a serpent,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then (Moses) threw his rod, and behold! it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!

verses.text: وَ نَزَعَ‌ يَدَهُ‌ فَإِذَا هِيَ‌ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و دستش را از گریبانش بیرون کشید که ناگاه دست برای بینندگان سپید و درخشان گشت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و دستش را بيرون آورد، در نظر آنان كه مى‌ديدند سفيد و درخشان بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و دست خود [از گريبان‌] برآورد كه ناگه براى ناظران درخشان گرديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و دست خود را [از گريبان‌] بيرون كشيد و ناگهان براى تماشاگران سپيد [و درخشنده‌] بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و دست (از گریبان خود) برآورد که ناگاه بینندگان را سپید و رخشان بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و دست خود را (از گریبان) بیرون آورد، به ناگاه بینندگان دیدند که (همچون خورشید، درخشان و) سفید است. [[«نَزَعَ»: بیرون آورد (نگا: قصص. 75). «بَیْضَآءُ»: سفید. مراد نورانی و درخشان است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و دستش را [از گریبانش‌] بیرون آورد، و ناگهان سپید و درخشان در دید تماشاگران پدیدار شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و دست خود را (از گریبان) بیرون آورد؛ سفید (و درخشان) برای بینندگان بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برآورد دستش را ناگهان آن پرتوی است برای بینندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و دست خويش [از گريبان‌] بيرون آورد، پس آن براى بينندگان سفيد و تابان مى‌نمود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و دستش را (از گریبانش بیرون) کشید، پس ناگهان برای تماشاگران سپید و درخشان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And he drew forth his hand, and behold, it looked white to those who beheld it.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And putting his hand in his bosom, withdrew it – so it shone brightly before the beholders.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it was white to the beholders.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he drew forth his hand, when lo: it was white unto the beholders.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And he drew out his hand, and behold! it was white (with radiance) for the beholders.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And He pulled out his hand, and it was white to the onlookers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then he drew out his hand, and it appeared luminous to all beholders.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And he drew out his hand, and behold! it was white (with radiance) for the beholders.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And he drew forth his hand (from his bosom), and lo! it was white for the beholders.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to the onlookers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then he drew out his hand and it was luminous to the onlookers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white [with radiance] for the observers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Then he uncovered his hand and it appeared sheer white to the onlookers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And he drew forth his hand, and lo! it was white to the beholders.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WanazaAAa yadahu faitha hiya baydao lilnnathireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and he drew forth his hand, and it appeared [shining] white to the beholders.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And he drew out his hand, and behold! it was white to all beholders!

verses.text: قَالَ‌ الْمَلَأُ مِنْ‌ قَوْمِ‌ فِرْعَوْنَ‌ إِنَ‌ هٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اشراف و سران قوم فرعون گفتند: قطعاً این جادوگری [زبردست و] داناست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مهتران قوم فرعون گفتند: اين جادوگرى است دانا.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سران قوم فرعون گفتند: به راستى اين جادوگرى ماهر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سران قوم فرعون گفتند: «بى‌شك، اين [مرد] ساحرى داناست.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مهتران قوم فرعون گفتند که این شخص ساحری سخت ماهر و داناست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (هنگامی که موسی نشانه‌ی بزرگ خدا را بنمود) اشراف قوم فرعون (از راه تملّق و چاپلوسی با فرعون هم‌آوا شدند و) گفتند: واقعاً این جادوگر ماهری است! (و کاری که می‌کند معجزه‌ی خدائی نیست). [[«عَلِیمٌ»: بسیار دانا در دانش جادوگری و فوت و فن آن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بزرگان قوم فرعون گفتند این [مرد] جادوگری داناست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اطرافیان فرعون گفتند: «بی‌شک، این ساحری ماهر و دانا است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند توده‌ای از قوم فرعون این است جادوگری دانشمند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مهتران قوم فرعون گفتند: همانا اين جادوگرى داناست

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سران قوم فرعون گفتند: «بی‌شک این (مرد) ساحری بس داناست.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The nobles of Pharaoh said: "He surely is a clever magician.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said the chieftains of Firaun’s people, “He is really an expert magician.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said the Council of the people of Pharaoh, 'Surely this man is a cunning sorcerer

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The chiefs of the people of Fir'awn said: verily this is a magician knowing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The chiefs of the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "This is indeed a well-versed sorcerer;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The notables among Pharaoh’s people said, “This is really a skilled magician.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The elders of Pharaoh's people said: 'Surely this man is a skilful magician

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The chiefs of the people of Fir`awn said: "This is indeed a well-versed sorcerer."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: The chiefs of Pharaoh's people said: Lo! this is some knowing wizard,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The elite of Pharaoh’s people said, ‘This is indeed an expert magician;

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The assembly of Pharaoh's nation said: 'This man is a wellversed sorcerer

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Said the eminent among the people of Pharaoh, "Indeed, this is a learned magician

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Some of the Pharaoh's nobles considered him to be no more than a skillful magician

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The chiefs of Firon's people said: most surely this is an enchanter possessed of knowledge:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala almalao min qawmi firAAawna inna hatha lasahirun AAaleemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan

translations.text: He said, 'Yes, indeed; and you shall be among the near-stationed.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: yea! and verily ye shall be of those brought nigh.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He said: "Yes, and moreover you will (in that case) be of the nearest (to me)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Yes, and you will be among my favorites.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Pharaoh replied: 'Certainly, and you shall be among those who are near to me.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Yes, and moreover you will (in that case) be of the nearest (to me)."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He answered: Yes, and surely ye shall be of those brought near (to me).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Of course! And indeed you shall be among those near [to me].’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Yes' he answered, 'and you will be among those near'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "Yes, and, [moreover], you will be among those made near [to me]."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Pharaoh replied, "In addition to your rewards, you will become my close friends thereafter."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Yes, and you shall certainly be of those who are near (to me).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala naAAam wainnakum lamina almuqarrabeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Pharaoh replied, "Certainly, and you shall also become my courtiers."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "Yea, (and more),- for ye shall in that case be (raised to posts) nearest (to my person)."

verses.text: قَالُوا يَا مُوسَى‌ إِمَّا أَنْ‌ تُلْقِيَ‌ وَ إِمَّا أَنْ‌ نَکُونَ‌ نَحْنُ‌ الْمُلْقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: جادوگران گفتند: ای موسی! یا تو [چوب دست خود را] بینداز، یا اینکه ما می اندازیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: اى موسى، آيا نخست تو مى‌افكنى، يا ما بيفكنيم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: اى موسى! تو اول مى‌افكنى يا ما بيفكنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «اى موسى، آيا تو مى‌افكنى و يا اينكه ما مى‌افكنيم؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ساحران به موسی گفتند: اکنون خواهی نخست تو عصای خود بیفکن یا ما بساط سحر خویش بیندازیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (سپس جادوگران مغرورانه رو به موسی کردند و) گفتند: ای موسی! یا تو (عصای خود را) بینداز یا ما (ریسمانهای خویش را) می‌اندازیم. [[«إِمَّا»: یا این که. «الْمُلْقِینَ»: اندازندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند ای موسی اول تو می‌اندازی یا ما باید اندازنده باشیم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (روز مبارزه فرا رسید. ساحران) گفتند: «ای موسی! یا تو (وسایل سحرت را) بیفکن، یا ما می‌افکنیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند ای موسی یا تو افکن و یا ما باشیم افکنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: اى موسى، تو مى‌افكنى يا ما بيفكنيم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «ای موسی! آیا تو می‌افکنی و یا اینکه (همین) ما خودمان افکنندگانیم!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So they said: "O Moses, you may cast your spell first, or we shall cast ours."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “O Moosa! You may throw first – or shall we be the first to throw?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'Moses, wilt thou cast, or shall we be the casters?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: O Musa! either thou cast down, or we shall be the ones to cast down.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "O Musa (Moses)! Either you throw (first), or shall we have the (first) throw?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “O Moses! Either you throw, or we are the ones to throw.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then they said: 'O Moses, will you [first] throw your rod, or shall we throw?'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "O Musa! Either you throw (first), or shall we have the (first) throw"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: O Moses! Either throw (first) or let us be the first throwers?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘O Moses, will you throw [first], or shall we throw?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They said: 'Moses, will you throw first or shall we be the throwers'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the ones to throw [first]."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The magicians asked Moses, "Will you throw your staff first or shall we?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: O Musa! will you cast, or shall we be the first to cast?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo ya moosa imma an tulqiya waimma an nakoona nahnu almulqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "Moses, will you first throw, or shall we?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "O Moses! wilt thou throw (first), or shall we have the (first) throw?"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ أَلْقُوا فَلَمَّا أَلْقَوْا سَحَرُوا أَعْيُنَ‌ النَّاسِ‌ وَ اسْتَرْهَبُوهُمْ‌ وَ جَاءُوا بِسِحْرٍ عَظِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [موسی] گفت: شما بیندازید. هنگامی که انداختند، چشم های مردم را جادو کردند و آنان را سخت ترساندند، و جادویی بزرگ و شگفت آور به میان آوردند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: شما بيفكنيد. چون افكندند، ديدگان مردم را جادو كردند و آنان را ترسانيدند و جادويى عظيم آوردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: شما بيفكنيد. و چون افكندند، مردم را چشم بندى كردند و آنها را ترساندند و سحر بزرگى آوردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «شما بيفكنيد.» و چون افكندند، ديدگان مردم را افسون كردند و آنان را به ترس انداختند و سحرى بزرگ در ميان آوردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: موسی گفت: شما اول اسباب خود بیفکنید. چون بساط خود انداختند به جادوگری چشم خلق بربستند و مردم را سخت به هراس افکندند، و سحری بس عظیم و هول‌انگیز برانگیختند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: موسی گفت: شما (آنچه دارید) بیندازید. هنگامی که (وسائل جادوگری خود را) بینداختند، مردم را چشم‌بندی کردند و ایشان را به هراس افکندند و جادوی بزرگی از خود نشان دادند. [[«سَحَرُوا أَعْیُنَ النَّاسِ»: مراد این است که به مردم چنین نمودند که ریسمانهایشان مارهای زنده‌اند، در صورتی که چنین نبود (نگا: طه / 66). «إِسْتَرْهَبُوهُمْ»: آنان را به هراس فراوانی انداختند تا آنجا که موسی نیز بترسید (نگا: طه / 67 و 68).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت شما بیندازید، و چون درانداختند، مردمان را چشم‌بندی کردند و به هول و هراس انداختند و جادویی سترگ به میان آوردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «شما بیفکنید!» و هنگامی (که وسایل سحر خود را) افکندند، مردم را چشم‌بندی کردند و ترساندند؛ و سحر عظیمی پدید آوردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت بیفکنید پس گاهی که افکندند افسون نمودند (بستند) دیدگان مردم را و بترساندندشان و آوردند جادوئی‌گران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: شما بيفكنيد و چون بيفكندند، چشمهاى مردم را جادو كردند و آنان را سخت ترسانيدند و جادويى بزرگ آوردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: « (همین) شما بیفکنید.» پس چون افکندند، دیدگان مردم را افسون کردند و آنان را به ترس انداختند و سحری بزرگ (به میان) آوردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "You cast it first," answered Moses. When they cast their spell, they bewitched the eyes of the people and petrified them by conjuring up a great charm.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “You throw”; when they threw, they cast a magic spell upon the people’s eyes and terrified them, and they brought a great magic.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'You cast.' And when they cast they put a Spell upon the people's eyes, and called forth fear of them, and produced a mighty sorcery.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: cast ye. Then when they cast clown, they enchanted the eyes of the people, and terrified them and brought mighty magic to bear.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He [Musa (Moses)] said: "Throw you (first)." So when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people, and struck terror into them, and they displayed a great magic.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “You throw!” And when they threw, they beguiled the eyes of the people, and intimidated them, and produced a mighty magic.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses said: 'You throw.' So when they threw [their rods], they enchanted the eyes of the people, and struck them with awe, and produced a mighty sorcery.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He [Musa] said: "Throw you (first)." So when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people, and struck terror into them, and they displayed a great trick.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Throw! And when they threw they cast a spell upon the people's eyes, and overawed them, and produced a mighty spell.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Throw [yours].’ So when they threw, they bewitched the people’s eyes and overawed them, producing a tremendous magic.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Throw' he replied. And when they threw, they bewitched the people's eyes and terrified them, and produced great sorcery.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "Throw," and when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them, and they presented a great [feat of] magic.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He replied, "Throw yours first." Their great magic bewitched people's eyes and terrified them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Cast. So when they cast, they deceived the people's eyes and frightened them, and they produced a mighty enchantment.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala alqoo falamma alqaw saharoo aAAyuna alnnasi waistarhaboohum wajaoo bisihrin AAatheemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He said, "You throw [first]!" When they made their cast, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck them with awe, for they showed a great [feat of] magic.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Said Moses: "Throw ye (first)." So when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people, and struck terror into them: for they showed a great (feat of) magic.

verses.text: وَ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَى‌ مُوسَى‌ أَنْ‌ أَلْقِ‌ عَصَاکَ‌ فَإِذَا هِيَ‌ تَلْقَفُ‌ مَا يَأْفِکُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به موسی وحی کردیم: عصایت را بینداز. ناگهان آنچه را جادوگران به دروغ بافته بودند، به سرعت بلعید!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و به موسى وحى كرديم كه عصاى خود را بيفكن. به ناگاه ديدند كه همه جادوهايشان را مى‌بلعد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به موسى وحى كرديم كه عصاى خويش بيفكن. پس همان دم ساخته‌هاى آنها را [يك به يك‌] مى‌بلعيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به موسى وحى كرديم كه: «عصايت را بينداز»؛ پس [انداخت و اژدها شد] و ناگهان آنچه را به دروغ ساخته بودند فرو بلعيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما به موسی وحی نمودیم که عصای خود را بیفکن، (چون عصا انداخت) ناگاه معجزه او هر چه ساحران بافته بودند یکباره همه را ببلعید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به موسی وحی کردیم که عصای خود را بینداز. ناگهان (به صورت اژدهائی درآمد و) به سرعت آنچه را بهم می‌بافتند (و تزویرهائی را که می‌نمودند همه را) بلعید. [[«تَلْقَفُ»: می‌بلعد. قورت می‌دهد. از ماده (لَقْف) به معنی به سرعت بلعیدن. «یَأْفِکُونَ»: به هم می‌بافتند. به دروغ سرهم می‌کردند. از ماده (إِفْک) به معنی بدترین دروغ. بهتان و افتراء.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و [ما] به موسی وحی کردیم که عصایت را بینداز، [انداخت و اژدها شد] و ناگهان برساخته‌هایشان را فرو بلعید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (ما) به موسی وحی کردیم که: «عصای خود را بیفکن!» ناگهان (بصورت مار عظیمی در آمد که) وسایل دروغین آنها را بسرعت برمی‌گرفت.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و وحی نمودیم به موسی که بیفکن عصای خویش را ناگهان فروبرد آنچه را دروغ آورند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ما به موسى وحى كرديم كه عصايت را بيفكن ناگاه آن عصا آنچه را [به جادو و دروغ‌] ساخته بودند مى‌بلعيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و سوی موسی وحی کردیم که: «عصایت را بیفکن.» پس (انداخت، ناگهان اژدری شد و) آنچه را به دروغ می‌ساختند فرو می‌بلعد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We said to Moses: "Throw down your staff;" and it swallowed up their conjurations in no time.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We inspired Moosa that, “Put forth your staff”; it immediately began swallowing up their fabrications.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We revealed to Moses: 'Cast thy staff!' And lo, it forthwith swallowed up their lying invention.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And we revealed unto Musa: cast down thy rod. And lo! it Was swallowing up that which they had feigned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We inspired Musa (Moses) (saying): "Throw your stick," and behold! It swallowed up straight away all the falsehoods which they showed.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We inspired Moses: “Throw your staff.” And at once, it swallowed what they were faking.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then We directed Moses: 'Now you throw your rod.' And lo! it swallowed up all their false devices.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We revealed to Musa (saying): "Throw your stick," and behold! It swallowed up straight away all the falsehood which they showed.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We inspired Moses (saying): Throw thy staff! And lo! it swallowed up their lying show.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And We signalled to Moses: ‘Throw down your staff.’ And behold, it was swallowing what they had faked.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then We revealed to Moses: 'Now, throw down your staff' And thereupon it swallowed up their false invention.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We inspired to Moses, "Throw your staff," and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We inspired Moses to throw his staff, and suddenly it began to swallow-up all that the magicians had (falsely) invented.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We revealed to Musa, saying: Cast your rod; then lo! it devoured the lies they told.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waawhayna ila moosa an alqi AAasaka faitha hiya talqafu ma yafikoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then We inspired Moses, saying, "Throw down your staff." And it immediately swallowed up their false devices.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We put it into Moses's mind by inspiration: "Throw (now) thy rod": and behold! it swallows up straight away all the falsehoods which they fake!

verses.text: فَوَقَعَ‌ الْحَقُ‌ وَ بَطَلَ‌ مَا کَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس حق ثابت شد و آنچه را همواره جادوگران [به عنوان سِحر] انجام می دادند، باطل و پوچ گشت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس حق به ثبوت رسيد و كارهاى آنان باطل شد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس حقيقت ثابت شد و كارى كه مى‌كردند بر باد رفت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس حقيقت آشكار گرديد و كارهايى كه مى‌كردند باطل شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس حق ثابت شد و اعمال ساحران همه باطل گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس حق (یعنی صدق موسی) ثابت و ظاهر گردید و آنچه آنان می‌کردند باطل شد (و پوچ از آب درآمد). [[«وَقَعَ»: استوار و آشکار گردید. ثابت و ظاهر شد. «بَطَلَ»: پوچ و باطل شد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه حق برقرار شد و کار و کوشش آنان بر باد رفت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (در این هنگام،) حق آشکار شد؛ و آنچه آنها ساخته بودند، باطل گشت.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بیامد حقّ و باطل شد آنچه بودند می‌کردند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس حق پديدار شد و آنچه آنها مى‌كردند نابود گشت

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس حقیقت پای‌برجا گردید و کارهایی که می‌کردند باطل گشت.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Thus the truth was upheld, and the falsehood that they practised was exposed.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So the truth was proved and their works were disproved.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So the truth came to pass, and false was proved what they were doing.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Thus the truth prevailed, and that which they had brought vanished.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Thus truth was confirmed, and all that they did was made of no effect.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So the truth came to pass, and what they were producing came to nothing.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thus was the truth established, and their doings proved in vain.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Thus truth was confirmed, and all that they did was made of no effect.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thus was the Truth vindicated and that which they were doing was made vain.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So the truth came out, and what they had wrought was reduced to naught.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So, the truth prevailed and what they were doing was annulled;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So the truth was established, and abolished was what they were doing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Thus the Truth prevailed and their false art was banished.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So the truth was established, and what they did became null.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: FawaqaAAa alhaqqu wabatala ma kanoo yaAAmaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Thus the truth prevailed and what they had produced came to nothing:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thus truth was confirmed, and all that they did was made of no effect.

verses.text: فَغُلِبُوا هُنَالِکَ‌ وَ انْقَلَبُوا صَاغِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [فرعونیان] در آنجا مغلوب شدند و با ذلت و خواری بازگشتند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در همان جا مغلوب شدند، و خوار و زبون بازگشتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اين جا بود كه شكست خوردند و با خوارى برگشتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در آنجا مغلوب و خوار گرديدند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: عاقبت فرعونیان در آنجا مغلوب شده و خوار و سرشکسته بازگشتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در آنجا (که گرد آمده بودند، فرعون و فرعونیان) شکست خوردند و (از آنجا به شهر) خوار و رسوا برگشتند. [[«إنقَلَبُوا»: برگشتند. «صَاغِرِینَ»: رسوایانه و زبونانه. جمع (صاغِر) به معنی خوار و مفتضح. معنی آیه می‌تواند چنین نیز باشد: در آنجا شکست خوردند و خوار و رسوا گشتند. در این صورت (انقلاب) مَجاز از (صَیْرُورت) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آنجا بود که شکست خوردند و خرد و خوار شدند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در آنجا (همگی) مغلوب شدند؛ و خوار و کوچک گشتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس شکست خوردند در آن هنگام و بازگشتند سرافکندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [فرعونيان‌] در آنجا شكست خوردند و خوار و زبون گشتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس در آن‌جا مغلوب گشته و به خواری و بی‌مقداری برگشتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Thus there and then they were vanquished and overthrown, humiliated.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They were therefore defeated here and they turned back humiliated.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So they were vanquished there, and they turned about, humbled.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Thus they were overcome and made to look abiect.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So they were defeated there and then, and were returned disgraced.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: There they were defeated, and utterly reduced.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Pharaoh and his men were defeated and put to shame,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So they were defeated there and returned disgraced.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thus were they there defeated and brought low.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thereat they were vanquished, and they retreated, humiliated.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: they were defeated and turned belittled,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Pharaoh and his people were overcome right there and became debased.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The magicians who were defeated on the spot and were proved to be worthless,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Thus they were vanquished there, and they went back abased.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faghuliboo hunalika wainqalaboo saghireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Pharaoh and his men were defeated and utterly humiliated.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So the (great ones) were vanquished there and then, and were made to look small.

verses.text: وَ أُلْقِيَ‌ السَّحَرَةُ سَاجِدِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and the sorcerers prostrated themselves,

translations.name: Saheeh International

verses.text: قَالَ‌ فِرْعَوْنُ‌ آمَنْتُمْ‌ بِهِ‌ قَبْلَ‌ أَنْ‌ آذَنَ‌ لَکُمْ‌ إِنَ‌ هٰذَا لَمَکْرٌ مَکَرْتُمُوهُ‌ فِي‌ الْمَدِينَةِ لِتُخْرِجُوا مِنْهَا أَهْلَهَا فَسَوْفَ‌ تَعْلَمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: فرعون گفت: آیا پیش از آنکه من به شما اجازه دهم به او ایمان آوردید؟! مسلماً این توطئه و نیرنگی است که [شما و موسی] در این شهر برپا کرده اید تا مردمش را از آن بیرون کنید، ولی به زودی خواهید دانست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: فرعون گفت: آيا پيش از آنكه من به شما رخصت دهم به او ايمان آورديد؟ اين حيله‌اى است كه درباره اين شهر انديشيده‌ايد تا مردمش را بيرون كنيد. به زودى خواهيد دانست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: فرعون گفت: پيش از آن كه به شما رخصت دهم به او ايمان آورديد؟! حتما اين توطئه‌اى است كه در شهر به راه انداخته‌ايد تا ساكنانش را از آن بيرون كنيد، پس به زودى خواهيد دانست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرعون گفت: «آيا پيش از آنكه به شما رخصت دهم، به او ايمان آورديد؟ قطعاً اين نيرنگى است كه در شهر به راه انداخته‌ايد تا مردمش را از آن بيرون كنيد. پس به زودى خواهيد دانست.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: فرعون گفت: چگونه پیش از دستور و اجازه من به او ایمان آوردید؟ همانا این مکری است که در این شهر اندیشیده‌اید که مردم این شهر را از آن بیرون کنید، پس به زودی خواهید دانست!

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: فرعون گفت: آیا به خدای (موسی و هارون) ایمان آوردید پیش از آن که به شما اجازه دهم؟ حتماً این توطئه‌ای است که در این شهر (و دیار، پیش‌تر با هم) چیده‌اید تا اهل آن را از آنجا بیرون کنید؛ ولی خواهید دانست (که چه شکنجه‌ای در برابر این رفتارتان خواهید چشید). [[«بِهِ»: مرجع ضمیر (ه) می‌تواند خدا یا موسی باشد. «آذَنَ»: اجازه دهم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: فرعون گفت آیا پیش از آنکه من به شما اجازه دهم به او ایمان آوردید؟ این مکری است که در شهر با همدیگر سگالیده‌اید تا اهل شهر را از آن آواره کنید، به زودی خواهید دانست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: فرعون گفت: «آیا پیش از آنکه به شما اجازه دهم، به او ایمان آوردید؟! حتماً این نیرنگ و توطئه‌ای است که در این شهر (و دیار) چیده‌اید، تا اهلش را از آن بیرون کنید؛ ولی بزودی خواهید دانست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت فرعون آیا ایمان آوردید بدو پیش از آنکه اذنتان دهم همانا آن نیرنگی است که شما در شهر باختید تا برون رانید از آن مردمش را زود است بدانید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: فرعون گفت: پيش از آنكه شما را رخصت دهم به او ايمان آورديد؟ اين ترفندى است كه در اين شهر انديشيده‌ايد تا مردمش را از آنجا بيرون كنيد پس بزودى خواهيد دانست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرعون گفت: «آیا پیش از آنکه به شما رخصت دهم به او ایمان آوردید؟ بی‌چون این (خود) نیرنگی است که همواره در شهر به راه انداخته‌اید تا مردمش را از آن بیرون کنید، پس در آینده‌ای دور خواهید دانست.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But Pharaoh said: "You have come to accept belief in Him without my permission! This surely is a plot you have hatched to expel the people from the land. You will soon come to know.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Firaun, “You have accepted faith in Him before I gave you permission! This is indeed a grand conspiracy you have plotted in the city, in order to expel its people from it; so now you will come to know!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said Pharaoh, 'You have believed in Him before I gave you leave. Surely this is a device you have devised in the city that you may expel its people from it. Now you shall know!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Fir'awn said:? believed ye in him ere I have given you leave? Verily this is a plot ye have plotted in the city that ye may drive forth the people thereof So presently ye shall know.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "You have believed in him [Musa (Moses)] before I give you permission. Surely, this is a plot which you have plotted in the city to drive out its people, but you shall come to know.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Pharaoh said, “Did you believe in Him before I have given you permission? This is surely a conspiracy you schemed in the city, in order to expel its people from it. You will surely know.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Pharaoh said: 'What! Do you believe before you have my permission? Surely this is a plot you have contrived to drive out the rulers from the capital. So you shall see,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Fir`awn said: "You have believed in him [Musa] before I gave you permission. Surely, this is a plot which you have plotted in the city to drive out its people, but you shall come to know."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Pharaoh said: Ye believe in Him before I give you leave! Lo! this is the plot that ye have plotted in the city that ye may drive its people hence. But ye shall come to know!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Pharaoh said, ‘Do you profess faith in Him before I may permit you? It is indeed a plot you have devised in the city to expel its people from it. Soon you will know [the consequences]!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Pharaoh said: 'Do you believe in Him before I permit? This is a plot that you have contrived in the city in order to expel its people from it. Now you shall know!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Said Pharaoh, "You believed in him before I gave you permission. Indeed, this is a conspiracy which you conspired in the city to expel therefrom its people. But you are going to know.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Pharaoh said to the magicians, "You declared your belief in him (Moses) without my permission. This is a plot to throw my people out of their city. But you will soon know.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Firon said: Do you believe in Him before I have given you permission? Surely this is a plot which you have secretly devised in this city, that you may turn out of it its people, but you shall know:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala firAAawnu amantum bihi qabla an athana lakum inna hatha lamakrun makartumoohu fee almadeenati litukhrijoo minha ahlaha fasawfa taAAlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Pharaoh said, "You dare believe in Him before I have given you permission? Behold, this is indeed a plot which you have devised in this city in order to drive its people out. But you shall soon know the consequences,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Said Pharaoh: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this is a trick which ye have planned in the city to drive out its people: but soon shall ye know (the consequences).

verses.text: لَأُقَطِّعَنَ‌ أَيْدِيَکُمْ‌ وَ أَرْجُلَکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ خِلاَفٍ‌ ثُمَ‌ لَأُصَلِّبَنَّکُمْ‌ أَجْمَعِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: قطعاً دست ها و پاهایتان را یکی از چپ و یکی از راست جدا می کنم، سپس همه شما را به دار خواهم آویخت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: دستها و پايهايتان را به خلاف يكديگر خواهم بريد و همگيتان را بر دار خواهم كرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: حتما، و يقينا دست‌ها و پاهايتان را چپ و راست قطع مى‌كنم، آن‌گاه شما را جملگى به دار مى‌زنم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: دستها و پاهايتان را يكى از چپ و يكى از راست خواهم بريد سپس همه شما را به دار خواهم آويخت.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همانا دست و پای شما را یکی از راست و یکی از چپ بریده و آن گاه همه را به دار خواهم آویخت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سوگند می‌خورم که دستها و پاهای شما را در جهت خلاف یکدیگر (یعنی دست راست با پای چپ، یا دست چپ با پای راست) قطع می‌کنم و (با این حالِ پریشان و وضع اسفناک) همگی شما را به دار می‌آویزم. [[«أُصَلِّبَنَّکُمْ»: شما را به دار می‌زنم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که دستان و پاهایتان را در خلاف جهت همدیگر خواهم برید، سپس همگی‌تان را به دار خواهم زد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سوگند می‌خورم که دستها و پاهای شما را بطور مخالف [= دست راست با پای چپ، یا دست چپ با پای راست‌] قطع می‌کنم؛ سپس همگی را به دار می‌آویزم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا سخت ببرّم دستها و پاهای شما را از برابر (دست راست پای چپ) سپس به دارتان کشم همگی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه دستها و پاهاى شما را به خلاف يكديگر- يكى از راست و يكى از چپ- ببُرم، سپس همه شما را بر دار كشم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «دست‌ها و پاهایتان را بی‌گمان برخلاف یکدیگر بی‌امان خواهم برید، سپس بی‌چون همه‌ی شما را همواره به دار خواهم آویخت.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "I will have your hands and feet on alternate sides cut off, and have you all crucified."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “I swear I will cut off your hands and your feet from alternate sides and then crucify you all.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you all together.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Surely I will cut off your hands and feet on the opposite sides and thereafter I will crucify you all.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Surely, I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, then I will crucify you all."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will crucify you all.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: I shall cut off your hands and feet on the opposite sides, and then crucify you all.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Surely, I will cut off your hands and your feet from opposite sides, then I will crucify you all."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Surely I shall have your hands and feet cut off upon alternate sides. Then I shall crucify you every one.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Surely I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and then I will surely crucify all of you.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: I will cut off on opposite sides a hand and a foot, and then crucify you all'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will surely crucify you all."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: I will cut off your hands and feet on the alternate sides and crucify you all."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: I will certainly cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, then will I crucify you all together.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: LaoqatiAAanna aydiyakum waarjulakum min khilafin thumma laosallibannakum ajmaAAeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: I will cut off your hands and feet on alternate sides and then crucify you all!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on apposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross."

verses.text: قَالُوا إِنَّا إِلَى‌ رَبِّنَا مُنْقَلِبُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: ما به سوی پروردگارمان بازمی گردیم [بنابراین ترسی از مجازات تو نداریم.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: ما به نزد پروردگارمان باز مى‌گرديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: [هر چه مى‌خواهى بكن‌] ما به سوى پروردگارمان باز مى‌گرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «ما به سوى پروردگارمان بازخواهيم گشت.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ساحران گفتند: ما به سوی خدای خود باز می‌گردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (جادوگران بر اثر نور ایمان، هراسی به خود راه ندادند و) گفتند: (باکی نیست؛ چرا که) ما به سوی پروردگار خود برمی‌گردیم (و به رحمت و نعمت او دست می‌یابیم، لذا مرگ در راه او را با آغوش باز می‌پذیریم). [[«مُنقَلِبُونَ»: برگردندگان. رجوع‌کنندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند [هر چه می‌خواهی بکن‌] ما به پروردگارمان روی آورده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (ساحران) گفتند: «(مهم نیست،) ما به سوی پروردگارمان بازمی‌گردیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند همانا مائیم بسوی پروردگار خود بازگشت‌کنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: ما به پروردگار خويش باز مى‌گرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «به‌راستی سوی پروردگارمان بازگشت‌کنندگانیم.‌»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They answered: "We have (in any case) to go back to our Lord.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “We shall return to our Lord.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'Surely unto our Lord we are turning.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: verily unto our Lord we are turning.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "Verily, we are returning to our Lord.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “It is to our Lord that we will return.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They replied: 'We shall surely return to our Lord.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "Verily, we are returning to our Lord."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: Lo! We are about to return unto our Lord!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘Indeed we shall return to our Lord.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They replied: 'We shall surely turn to our Lord.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "Indeed, to our Lord we will return.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The magicians said, "We will certainly return to Our Lord.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: Surely to our Lord shall we go back:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo inna ila rabbina munqaliboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They replied, "We shall surely return to our Lord.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "For us, We are but sent back unto our Lord:

verses.text: وَ مَا تَنْقِمُ‌ مِنَّا إِلاَّ أَنْ‌ آمَنَّا بِآيَاتِ‌ رَبِّنَا لَمَّا جَاءَتْنَا رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ‌ عَلَيْنَا صَبْراً وَ تَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و تو ما را جز به این سبب به کیفر نمی رسانی که ما به آیات پروردگارمان هنگامی که به سوی ما آمد، ایمان آوردیم. [آن گاه به دعا روی آوردند و گفتند:] پروردگارا! صبر و شکیبایی بر ما فرو ریز و ما را در حالی که تسلیم [فرمان ها و احکامت] باشیم، بمیران.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خشم بر ما نمى‌گيرى، جز آنكه چون نشانه‌هاى پروردگارمان بر ما آشكار شد به آنها ايمان آورديم. اى پروردگار ما، بر ما شكيبايى ببار و ما را مسلمان بميران.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و تو از ما انتقام نمى‌گيرى مگر براى اين كه ما به آيات پروردگارمان- وقتى براى ما آمد- ايمان آورديم. بار الها! بر ما صبورى ببار و مسلمانمان بميران

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و تو جز براى اين ما را به كيفر نمى‌رسانى كه ما به معجزات پروردگارمان -وقتى براى ما آمد- ايمان آورديم. پروردگارا، بر ما شكيبايى فرو ريز و ما را مسلمان بميران.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و کینه و انتقام تو از ما تنها به جرم آن است که ما به آیات خدا چون برای (هدایت) ما آمد ایمان آوردیم، بار خدایا، به ما صبر و شکیبایی ده و ما را به آیین اسلام (یعنی با تسلیم و رضای به حکم خدا) بمیران.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ایراد تو بر ما و آزار رساندن تو به ما جز به خاطر این نیست که ما به آیات روشن و معجزات متقن پروردگارمان - وقتی که به ما رسیده است - ایمان آورده‌ایم (و فرمان خدای خود را لبّیک گفته‌ایم). پروردگارا! صبر عظیم به ما مرحمت فرما و ما را مسلمان بمیران. [[«مَا تَنقِمُ مِنَّا إِلاّ»: بر ما زشت نمی‌شماری مگر. از ما رخنه نمی‌گیری و بر ما عیب نمی‌دانی مگر. ما را عقوبت نمی‌کنی مگر به خاطر (نگا: بروج / 8). «أَفْرِغْ عَلَیْنَا»: بر ما بریز. مراد این است که ما را غرق شکیبائی و بردباری گردان. «مُسْلِمِینَ»: مطیعان فرمان و منقادان شریعت یزدان. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و فقط از آن روی با ما کینه می‌ورزی که به آیات پروردگارمان، به هنگامی که بر ما ظاهر شد، ایمان آورده‌ایم، پروردگارا بر ما [باران‌] صبر فروریز و ما را مسلمان بمیران‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: انتقام تو از ما، تنها بخاطر این است که ما به آیات پروردگار خویش -هنگامی که به سراغ ما آمد- ایمان آوردیم. بار الها! صبر و استقامت بر ما فرو ریز! (و آخرین درجه شکیبائی را به ما مرحمت فرما!) و ما را مسلمان بمیران!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و کین نورزی با ما جز بدانکه ایمان آوردیم به آیتهای پروردگار ما گاهی که بیامدند ما را پروردگارا بریز بر ما شکیبائی را و دریاب ما را مسلمانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و تو هيچ خشم و كينه‌اى از ما به دل ندارى مگر اينكه به نشانه‌هاى پروردگارمان آنگاه كه ما را بيامد ايمان آورديم. پروردگارا، بر ما شكيبايى فرو ريز و ما را مسلمان- گردن نهاده و فرمانبردار- بميران.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و تو از ما انتقام نمی‌گیری، مگر برای اینکه ما به نشانه‌های پروردگارمان - هنگامی‌که برایمان آمد - ایمان آوردیم. پروردگارمان! بر (سر و سامان)مان شکیبایی فرو ریز و ما را در حال تسلیم بمیران.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "The only reason you have to hate us is that we believed in the signs of our Lord as they came to us. O our Lord, give us sufficient endurance that we may die submitting (to You)."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And what did you dislike in us, except that we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us? Our Lord! Pour (bestow abundantly) patience on us, and bestow us death as Muslims.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Thou takest vengeance upon us only because we have believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Our Lord, pour out upon us patience, and gather us unto Thee surrendering.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And what is it for which thou takest vengeance on us save that we have believed in the signs of our Lord when they came unto us? Our Lord! pour out upon us perseverance and cause us to die as Muslims.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And you take vengeance on us only because we believed in the Ayat (proofs, evidences, lessons, signs, etc.) of our Lord when they reached us! Our Lord! pour out on us patience, and cause us to die as Muslims."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “You are taking vengeance on us only because we have believed in the signs of our Lord when they have come to us.” “Our Lord! Pour out patience upon us, and receive our souls in submission.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Will you punish us just because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us? Our Lord! Shower us with perseverance and cause us to die as those who have submitted [to You].'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And you take vengeance on us only because we believed in the Ayat of our Lord when they reached us! Our Lord! pour out on us patience, and cause us to die as Muslims."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thou takest vengeance on us only forasmuch as we believed the tokens of our Lord when they came unto us. Our Lord! Vouchsafe unto us steadfastness and make us die as men who have surrendered (unto Thee).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: You are vindictive toward us only because we have believed in the signs of our Lord, when they came to us.’ ‘Our Lord! Pour patience upon us, and grant us to die as Muslims.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: You would take revenge on us only because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Lord, pour patience upon us and let us die as submitters (Muslims)'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And you do not resent us except because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You]."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You only take revenge on us because we believed in the Lord when we saw His miracles. Lord, grant us patience and let us die Muslims (submitted to God)."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And you do not take revenge on us except because we have believed in the communications of our Lord when they came to us! Our Lord: Pour out upon us patience and cause us to die in submission.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama tanqimu minna illa an amanna biayati rabbina lamma jaatna rabbana afrigh AAalayna sabran watawaffana muslimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: You would punish us only because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they were shown to us. Our Lord, pour patience upon us, and cause us to die in a state of submission to You."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "But thou dost wreak thy vengeance on us simply because we believed in the Signs of our Lord when they reached us! Our Lord! pour out on us patience and constancy, and take our souls unto thee as Muslims (who bow to thy will)!

verses.text: وَ قَالَ‌ الْمَلَأُ مِنْ‌ قَوْمِ‌ فِرْعَوْنَ‌ أَ تَذَرُ مُوسَى‌ وَ قَوْمَهُ‌ لِيُفْسِدُوا فِي‌ الْأَرْضِ‌ وَ يَذَرَکَ‌ وَ آلِهَتَکَ‌ قَالَ‌ سَنُقَتِّلُ‌ أَبْنَاءَهُمْ‌ وَ نَسْتَحْيِي‌ نِسَاءَهُمْ‌ وَ إِنَّا فَوْقَهُمْ‌ قَاهِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اشراف و سران قوم فرعون گفتند: آیا موسی و قومش را رها می کنی تا در این سرزمین فساد و تباهی کنند و تو و معبودهایت را واگذارند؟ گفت: به زودی پسرانشان را به صورتی وسیع و گسترده به قتل می رسانیم و زنانشان را زنده می گذاریم و ما بر آنان چیره و مُسلّطیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مهتران قوم فرعون گفتند: آيا موسى و قومش را مى‌گذارى تا در زمين فساد كنند و تو و خدايانت را ترك گويد؟ گفت: پسرانشان را خواهم كشت و زنانشان را زنده خواهم گذاشت. ما بالاتر از ايشانيم و بر آنها غلبه مى‌يابيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سران قوم فرعون گفتند: آيا موسى و قوم او را وا مى‌گذارى كه در زمين فساد كنند و تو و خدايانت را واگذارد؟ گفت: به زودى پسرانشان را مى‌كشيم و زنانشان را زنده مى‌گذاريم كه بى‌ترديد ما بر آنان تسلط داريم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و سران قوم فرعون گفتند: «آيا موسى و قومش را رها مى‌كنى تا در اين سرزمين فساد كنند و [موسى‌] تو و خدايانت را رها كند؟» [فرعون‌] گفت: «بزودى پسرانشان را مى‌كُشيم و زنانشان را زنده نگاه مى‌داريم، و ما بر آنان مسلطيم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و سران قوم فرعون گفتند: آیا موسی و قومش را واگذاری تا در این سرزمین فساد کنند و تو و خدایان تو را رها سازند؟ فرعون گفت: به زودی پسرانشان را کشته و زنانشان را زنده گذاریم (و در رنج و عذاب خدمت و اسارت نگاه داریم) و ما بر آنها غالب و مقتدریم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اشراف قوم فرعون (بدو) گفتند: آیا موسی و پیروان او را آزاد و رها می‌سازی تا در سرزمین (مصر آزادانه) به فساد پردازند و تو و معبودان تو را ترک گویند (و نه به تو و نه به معبودان تو وقعی ننهند؟). گفت: پسران آنان را علی‌الدوام خواهیم کشت و دخترانشان را زنده نگاه می‌داریم (تا کلفت‌ها و گماشتگان ما گردند) و ما بر ایشان کاملاً مسلّط هستیم (و هرچه بخواهیم بر سر آنان می‌آوریم). [[«تَذَرُ»: رها می‌سازی. «سَنُقَتِّلُ»: خواهیم کشت. ذکر ماده (قَتَّلَ) از باب تفعیل برای مبالغه در کار و استمرار در آن است. «نَسْتَحْیِی»: زنده نگاه می‌داریم. «نِسَآءَ»: زنان. مراد جنس إناث یعنی زنان و دختران است. «قَاهِرُونَ»: غالبان. چیرگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بزرگان قوم فرعون گفتند آیا موسی و قومش را رها می‌کنی که در این سرزمین فساد برپا کنند، و تو و خدایانت را رها کنند؟ گفت به زودی پسرانشان را خواهیم کشت و زنان [و دختران‌]شان را [برای کنیزی‌] زنده خواهیم گذاشت و ما بر آنان چیره‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اشراف قوم فرعون (به او) گفتند: «آیا موسی و قومش را رها می‌کنی که در زمین فساد کنند، و تو و خدایانت را رها سازد؟!» گفت: «بزودی پسرانشان را می‌کشیم، و دخترانشان را زنده نگه می‌داریم (تا به ما خدمت کنند)؛ و ما بر آنها کاملاً مسلّطیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفتند توده‌ای از قوم فرعون آیا می‌گذاری موسی و قومش را تا فساد کنند در زمین و بگذاردت تو و خدایانت را گفت بزودی زار بکشیم فرزندان ایشان را و بگذاریم زنانشان را و همانا مائیم بر فراز ایشان نیرومندان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و مهتران قوم فرعون گفتند: آيا موسى و قوم او را وا مى‌گذارى تا در اين سرزمين تباهى كنند و تو و خدايانت را فروگذارند؟ گفت: هر آينه پسرانشان را خواهيم كشت و زنانشان را زنده نگه خواهيم داشت و ما بر آنها چيره‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و سران چشمگیر قوم فرعون گفتند: «آیا موسی و قومش را رها می‌کنی تا در (این) سرزمین افساد کنند، و تو و خدایانت را رها کند؟» (فرعون) گفت: «به‌زودی پسرانشان را پیاپی همی می‌کشیم و زنانشان را زنده و بی‌حیا نگه می‌داریم و ما در بلندا(ی قدرت) بر (سر و سامان) آنان چیره‌ایم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And the leaders of Pharaoh's people said to him: "Would you allow Moses and his people to create disorder in the land and discard you and your gods?" He replied: "We shall now slay their sons and spare their women, and subdue them."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The chieftains of Firaun’s people said, “Are you releasing Moosa and his people to cause turmoil in the land, and for Moosa to abandon you and your appointed deities?” He said, “We shall now slay their sons and spare their women; and indeed we have power over them.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then said the Council of the people of Pharaoh, 'Wilt thou leave Moses and his people to work corruption in the land, and leave thee and thy gods?' Said he, 'We shall slaughter their sons and spare their women; surely we are triumphant over them!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the chiefs of the people of Fir'awn said: wilt thou leave alone Musa and his people to act corruptly in the land and to leave alone thee and thy gods! He said: soon we shall slay their sons and let live their women, and we are masters over them.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The chiefs of Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people said: "Will you leave Musa (Moses) and his people to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon you and your gods?" He said: "We will kill their sons, and let live their women, and we have indeed irresistible power over them."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The chiefs of Pharaoh's people said, “Will you let Moses and his people cause trouble in the land, and forsake you and your gods?” He said, “We will kill their sons, and spare their women. We have absolute power over them.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The elders of Pharaoh's people said: 'Will you leave alone Moses and his people to spread mischief in the land, and forsake you and your gods?' Pharaoh replied: 'We will kill their male children and spare their female ones. For indeed we hold irresistible sway over them.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The chiefs of Fir`awn's people said: "Will you leave Musa and his people to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon you and your gods" He said: "We will kill their sons, and let their women live, and we have indeed irresistible power over them."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: The chiefs of Pharaoh's people said: (O King), wilt thou suffer Moses and his people to make mischief in the land, and flout thee and thy gods? He said: We will slay their sons and spare their women, for lo! we are in power over them.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The elite of Pharaoh’s people said, ‘Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land, and to abandon you and your gods?’ He said, ‘We will kill their sons and spare their women, and indeed we are dominant over them.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The assembly of Pharaoh's nation said: 'Will you allow Moses and his nation to corrupt in the land and to forsake you and your gods' He replied: 'We will put their sons to death and spare their women, indeed we are conquerors over them'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said," Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?" [Pharaoh] said, "We will kill their sons and keep their women alive; and indeed, we are subjugators over them."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Some of the Pharaohs people said, "Will you let Moses and his people destroy the land and disregard you and your gods?" The Pharaoh said, "We will kill their sons and leave their women alive; they are under our domination."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the chiefs of Firon's people said: Do you leave Musa and his people to make mischief in the land and to forsake you and your gods? He said: We will slay their sons and spare their women, and surely we are masters over them.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqala almalao min qawmi firAAawna atatharu moosa waqawmahu liyufsidoo fee alardi wayatharaka waalihataka qala sanuqattilu abnaahum wanastahyee nisaahum wainna fawqahum qahiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The chiefs of Pharaoh's people said, "Will you allow Moses and his people to spread corruption in the land, and to forsake you and your gods?" He replied, "We shall kill their male children and spare only the females. We have complete power over them."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ مُوسَى‌ لِقَوْمِهِ‌ اسْتَعِينُوا بِاللَّهِ‌ وَ اصْبِرُوا إِنَ‌ الْأَرْضَ‌ لِلَّهِ‌ يُورِثُهَا مَنْ‌ يَشَاءُ مِنْ‌ عِبَادِهِ‌ وَ الْعَاقِبَةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: موسی به قومش گفت: از خدا یاری بخواهید، و شکیبایی ورزید، یقیناً زمین در سیطره مالکیّت و فرمانروایی خداست، آن را به هر کس از بندگانش که بخواهد می بخشد، و سرانجام نیک، برای پرهیزکاران است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: موسى به قومش گفت: از خدا مدد جوييد و صبر پيشه سازيد كه اين زمين از آن خداست و به هر كس از بندگانش كه بخواهد آن را به ميراث مى‌دهد. و سرانجام نيك از آن پرهيزگاران است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: موسى به قوم خود گفت: از خداوند مدد بجوييد و استقامت ورزيد كه زمين از آن خداست، آن را به هر كس از بندگانش كه بخواهد به ارث مى‌دهد، و فرجام [نيكو] از آن پرهيزكاران است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: موسى به قوم خود گفت: «از خدا يارى جوييد و پايدارى ورزيد، كه زمين از آنِ خداست؛ آن را به هر كس از بندگانش كه بخواهد مى‌دهد؛ و فرجام [نيك‌] براى پرهيزگاران است.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: موسی به قوم خود گفت: از خدا یاری خواهید و صبر کنید که زمین ملک خداست، آن را به هر کس از بندگان خود خواهد به میراث دهد، و حسن عاقبت مخصوص اهل تقواست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: موسی به قوم خود گفت: از خدا یاری جوئید و شکیبائی کنید (و بدانید که فرعون بنده‌ی ناتوانی بیش نیست و فرمانروای مطلق خدا است و) بیگمان خدا زمین را به کسانی از بندگان خود واگذار می‌کند که خود بخواهد، و سرانجام (نیک و پسندیده در گیر و دار جهان) از آن پرهیزگاران است (آن کسانی که مراعات سنن و اسباب می‌دارند. از قبیل اتّحاد و اتّفاق و اعتصام به حق و اقامت عدل و صبر در برابر شدائد). [[«یُورِثُهَا مَنْ»: آن را به کسانی وامی‌گذارد. آن را ملک کسانی می‌سازد. «الْعَاقِبَةُ»: مراد نتیجه پیروزمندانه و سرانجام خداپسندانه در دنیا و همچنین در آخرت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: موسی به قومش گفت از خداوند مدد بجویید و شکیبایی کنید، چرا که زمین از آن خداوند است، به هر کس از بندگانش که بخواهد به میراث می‌دهد و نیک سرانجامی از آن پرهیزگاران است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: موسی به قوم خود گفت: «از خدا یاری جویید، و استقامت پیشه کنید، که زمین از آن خداست، و آن را به هر کس از بندگانش که بخواهد، واگذار می‌کند؛ و سرانجام (نیک) برای پرهیزکاران است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت موسی به قوم خود کمک جوئید از خدا و شکیبا شوید همانا زمین از آن خدا است ارث دهدش به هر که از بندگان خود که خواهد و پایان است برای پرهیزکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: موسى قوم خود را گفت: از خدا يارى بخواهيد و شكيبايى ورزيد، كه زمين از آن خداست، آن را به هر كس از بندگانش كه بخواهد به ميراث مى‌دهد، و سرانجام [نيك‌]- پيروزى يا بهشت- پرهيزگاران راست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: موسی به قوم خود گفت: «از خدا یاری جویید و (پایداری و) شکیبایی ورزید. بی‌گمان زمین از آنِ خداست؛ آن را به هر کس از بندگانش که بخواهد به ارث (از دیگران) می‌دهد و (آن بزرگْ زندگی و) فرجام (نیک) برای پرهیزگاران است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Said Moses to his people: "Invoke the help of God and be firm. The earth belongs to God: He can make whom He wills among His creatures inherit it. The future is theirs who take heed for themselves."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Moosa said to his people, “Seek the help of Allah and patiently endure; indeed the Owner of the earth is Allah – He appoints as its successor whomever He wills; and the final triumph is for the pious.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said Moses to his people, 'Pray for succour to God, and be patient; surely the earth is God's and He bequeaths it to whom He will among His servants. The issue ultimate is to the godfearing.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Musa said unto his people: seek help in Allah and persevere; verily the earth is Allah's; He maketh whomsoever He willeth of His bondmen inherit it, and the happy end is of the God-fearing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Musa (Moses) said to his people: "Seek help in Allah and be patient. Verily, the earth is Allah's. He gives it as a heritage to whom He will of His slaves, and the (blessed) end is for the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Moses said to his people, “Seek help in God, and be patient. The earth belongs to God. He gives it in inheritance to whomever He wills of His servants, and the future belongs to the righteous.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses said to his people: 'Seek help from Allah and be steadfast. The earth is Allah's, He bestows it on those of His servants He chooses. The end of things belongs to the God-fearing.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Musa said to his people: "Seek help in Allah and be patient. Verily, the earth is Allah's. He gives it as a heritage to whom He wills of His servants; and the (blessed) end is for the pious and righteous persons."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Moses said unto his people: Seek help in Allah and endure. Lo! the earth is Allah's. He giveth it for an inheritance to whom He will. And lo! the sequel is for those who keep their duty (unto Him).
