translations.text: تو را از رستاخيز پرسند، كه فرارسيدن آن كى باشد؟ بگو: دانش آن تنها نزد پروردگار من است جز او آن را به هنگامش آشكار نكند. [فرارسيدن آن‌] در آسمانها و زمين گران است، فرا نرسد شما را مگر ناگاه. از تو چنان مى‌پرسند كه گويا از آن آگاهى. بگو: دانش آن تنها نزد خداست، ولى بيشتر مردم نمى‌دانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: از تو درباره‌ی ساعت [:قیامت] می‌پرسند، که وقفه‌اش [:تحویل ساعت دنیا به ساعت آخرت] چه وقت است‌؟ بگو: «علم آن، تنها نزد پروردگار من است. جز او (هیچ کس) آن را به موقع خود آشکار نمی‌گرداند. (این حادثه) بر آسمان‌ها و زمین گران است (و) جز (به) ناگهان شما را در نرسد.» از تو (به گونه‌ای) می‌پرسند (که) گویا تو از (زمان وقوع) آن آگاهی. بگو: «علم آن تنها نزد خداست، ولی بیشتر مردمان نمی‌دانند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They ask you about the Hour: "When is its determined time?" Say: "Only my Lord has the knowledge. No one can reveal it except He. Oppressive will it be for the heavens and the earth. When it comes, it will come unawares." They ask you about it as if you were in the know. You tell them: "Only God has the knowledge." But most people do not know.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They ask you about the Resurrection, as to when it is destined; say, “Indeed its knowledge is with my Lord; only He will manifest it at its time; it is proving cumbersome in the heavens and the earth; it will not come to you except suddenly”; they question you as if you have researched it deeply; say, “Indeed its knowledge is with Allah only but most people do not know.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They will question thee concerning the Hour, when it shall berth. Say: 'The knowledge of it is only with my Lord; none shall reveal it at its proper time, but He. Heavy is it in the heavens and the earth; it will not come on you but suddenly!' They will question thee, as though thou art well-informed of it. Say: 'The knowledge of it is only with God, but most men know not.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They ask thee concerning the Hour, when will its coming be? Say thou: knowledge thereof is with my Lord only: none shall disclose it at its time buthe; heavy it is in the heavens and the earth; it shall not come upon you except on a sudden. They ask thee as though thou wert familiar therewith. Say thou: knowledge thereof is with Allah only; but most of men know not.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They ask you about the Hour (Day of Resurrection): "When will be its appointed time?" Say: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord (Alone). None can reveal its time but He. Heavy is its burden through the heavens and the earth. It shall not come upon you except all of a sudden." They ask you as if you have a good knowledge of it. Say: "The knowledge thereof is with Allah (Alone) but most of mankind know not."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They ask you about the Hour, “When will it come?” Say, “Knowledge of it rests with my Lord. None can reveal its coming except He. It weighs heavily on the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except suddenly.” They ask you as if you are responsible for it. Say, “Knowledge of it rests with God,” but most people do not know.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They ask you concerning the Hour, when will its coming be? Say: 'The knowledge of it is with my Lord alone: none but He will disclose it at its time. That will weigh heavily on the heavens and the earth; and it shall not come to you other than all of a sudden.' They ask you - as if you are eagerly inquisitive about it - concerning it. Say to them: 'The knowledge of it is with none except Allah. But most people are unaware of this reality.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They ask you about the Hour (Day of Resurrection): "When will be its appointed time" Say: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord (Alone). None can reveal its time but He. Heavy is its burden through the heavens and the earth. It shall not come upon you except all of a sudden." They ask you as if you have a good knowledge of it. Say: "The knowledge thereof is with Allah (Alone), but most of mankind know not."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They ask thee of the (destined) Hour, when will it come to port. Say: Knowledge thereof is with my Lord only. He alone will manifest it at its proper time. It is heavy in the heavens and the earth. It cometh not to you save unawares. They question thee as if thou couldst be well informed thereof. Say: Knowledge thereof is with Allah only, but most of mankind know not.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They question you concerning the Hour, when will it set in? Say, ‘Its knowledge is only with my Lord: none except Him shall manifest it at its time. It will weigh heavy on the heavens and the earth. It will not overtake you but suddenly.’ They ask you as if you were in the know of it. Say, ‘Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most people do not know.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They ask you about the Hour and when it is to come. Say: 'None knows except my Lord. He alone will reveal it at the appointed time. It is heavy in the heavens and earth. It will not come to you but suddenly' They will question you, as though you had full knowledge of it. Say: 'Its knowledge is with Allah, though most people are unaware'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival? Say, "Its knowledge is only with my Lord. None will reveal its time except Him. It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except unexpectedly." They ask you as if you are familiar with it. Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most of the people do not know."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They ask you (Muhammad), "When will the Day of Judgment be?" Tell them, "My Lord knows best. It is He who has appointed its time. It will be a grave hour both in the heavens and the earth. It will only approach you suddenly." They say, "It seems that you know about the coming of the Day of Judgment." Tell them, "Only God knows about it and most people do not know."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They ask you about the hour, when will be its taking place? Say: The knowledge of it is only with my Lord; none but He shall manifest it at its time; it will be momentous in the heavens and the earth; it will not come on you but of a sudden. They ask you as if you were solicitous about it. Say: Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most people do not know.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yasaloonaka AAani alssaAAati ayyana mursaha qul innama AAilmuha AAinda rabbee la yujalleeha liwaqtiha illa huwa thaqulat fee alssamawati waalardi la tateekum illa baghtatan yasaloonaka kaannaka hafiyyun AAanha qul innama AAilmuha AAinda Allahi walakinna akthara alnnasi la yaAAlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They ask you [Prophet] about the Last Hour, "When will it come?" Say, "Knowledge about it rests only with my Lord; He alone will reveal when its time will come, it lies heavy on the heavens and the earth: it will suddenly overtake you." They will put questions to you as though you had full knowledge of it. Say, "Knowledge about it rests only with God, though most people do not realize it."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They ask thee about the (final) Hour - when will be its appointed time? Say: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord (alone): None but He can reveal as to when it will occur. Heavy were its burden through the heavens and the earth. Only, all of a sudden will it come to you." They ask thee as if thou Wert eager in search thereof: Say: "The knowledge thereof is with Allah (alone), but most men know not."

verses.text: قُلْ‌ لاَ أَمْلِکُ‌ لِنَفْسِي‌ نَفْعاً وَ لاَ ضَرّاً إِلاَّ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ‌ وَ لَوْ کُنْتُ‌ أَعْلَمُ‌ الْغَيْبَ‌ لاَسْتَکْثَرْتُ‌ مِنَ‌ الْخَيْرِ وَ مَا مَسَّنِيَ‌ السُّوءُ إِنْ‌ أَنَا إِلاَّ نَذِيرٌ وَ بَشِيرٌ لِقَوْمٍ‌ يُؤْمِنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: من قدرتِ [جلبِ] سودی و [دفعِ] زیانی را از خود ندارم جز آنچه خدا خواهد، و [غیب هم نمی دانم] اگر غیب می دانستم، یقیناً برای خود ازهر خیری فراوان و بسیار فراهم می کردم وهیچ گزند وآسیبی به من نمی رسید؛ من فقط برای گروهی که ایمان می آورند، بیم دهنده و مژده رسانم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: من مالك سود و زيان خود نيستم، مگر آنچه خدا بخواهد. و اگر علم غيب مى‌دانستم بر خير خود بسى مى‌افزودم و هيچ شرى به من نمى‌رسيد. من كسى جز بيم‌دهنده و مژده‌دهنده‌اى براى مؤمنان نيستم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: من مالك سود و زيان خود نيستم، مگر آنچه خدا خواسته باشد، و اگر غيب مى‌دانستم سود فراوانى مى‌اندوختم و هيچ زيانى به من نمى‌رسيد. من صرفا براى قومى كه ايمان مى‌آورند بيم‌رسان و بشارت دهنده‌ام

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «جز آنچه خدا بخواهد، براى خودم اختيار سود و زيانى ندارم، و اگر غيب مى‌دانستم قطعاً خير بيشترى مى‌اندوختم و هرگز به من آسيبى نمى‌رسيد. من جز بيم‌دهنده و بشارتگر براى گروهى كه ايمان مى‌آورند، نيستم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو که من مالک نفع و ضرر خویش نیستم مگر آنچه خدا خواسته، و اگر من از غیب (جز آنچه به وحی می‌دانم) آگاه بودم بر خیر و نفع خود همیشه می‌افزودم و هیچ‌گاه زیان و رنج نمی‌دیدم، من نیستم مگر رسولی ترساننده، و بشارت دهنده گروهی که اهل ایمانند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: من مالک سودی و زیانی برای خود نیستم، مگر آن مقداری که خدا بخواهد و (از راه لطف بر جلب نفع یا دفع شرّ، مالک و مقتدرم گرداند.) اگر غیب می‌دانستم، قطعاً منافع فراوانی نصیب خود می‌کردم (چرا که با اسباب آن آشنا بودم) و اصلاً شرّ و بلا به من نمی‌رسید (چرا که از موجبات آن آگاه بودم. حال که از اسباب خیرات و برکات و از موجبات آفات و مضرّات بی‌خبرم، چگونه از وقوع قیامت آگاه خواهم بود؟). من کسی جز بیم‌دهنده و مژده‌دهنده‌ی مؤمنان (به عذاب و ثواب یزدان) نمی‌باشم. [[«لاَسْتَکْثَرْتُ»: حتماً افزون‌طلبی می‌کردم. خیلی فراهم می‌آوردم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو که برای خود اختیار سود و زیانی ندارم مگر آنچه خدا بخواهد، و اگر غیب می‌دانستم خیر فراوان برای خود کسب می‌کردم و هیچ ناگواری به من نمی‌رسید، من کسی جز هشداردهنده و مژده‌آور اهل ایمان نیستم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «من مالک سود و زیان خویش نیستم، مگر آنچه را خدا بخواهد؛ (و از غیب و اسرار نهان نیز خبر ندارم، مگر آنچه خداوند اراده کند؛) و اگر از غیب باخبر بودم، سود فراوانی برای خود فراهم می‌کردم، و هیچ بدی (و زیانی) به من نمی‌رسید؛ من فقط بیم‌دهنده و بشارت‌دهنده‌ام برای گروهی که ایمان می‌آورند! (و آماده پذیرش حقند)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو دارا نیستم برای خویشتن سود و نه زیانی جز آنچه خدا خواهد و اگر دانای ناپیدا می‌بودم هر آینه فراوان می‌گرفتم از خوبی و به من نمی‌رسید بدی نیستم من مگر بیم‌دهنده و نویددهنده برای گروهی که ایمان آرند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: من مالك هيچ سود و زيانى براى خويش نيستم- من براى خود جلب سود و دفع زيان نتوانم- مگر آنچه خداى خواهد، و اگر غيب مى‌دانستم هر آينه نيكى و خواسته بسيار گرد مى‌كردم، و هيچ بدى و گزندى به من نمى‌رسيد. من جز بيم‌دهنده و نويدرسانى براى مردمى كه ايمان بياورند نيستم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «برای خودم سود و زیانی در توان ندارم، جز آنچه خدا خواسته، و اگر غیب می‌دانستم، به راستی از خیر فزونی بر می‌گرفتم و بدی به من نمی‌رسید. من جز هشداردهنده و بشارت‌دهنده‌ای - برای گروهی که ایمان می‌آورند - نیستم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Tell them: "I am not master of my own gain or loss but as God may please. If I had the knowledge of the Unknown I would have enjoyed abundance of the good, and no evil would have touched me. I am only a bearer of warnings and bringer of happy news for those who believe."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say, “I have no autonomy to benefit or hurt myself, except what Allah wills; and were I to procure knowledge of the hidden on my own, it would be that I had accumulated a lot of good; and no misfortune would touch me; I am purely a Herald of Warning and Glad Tidings to the people who believe.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'I have no power to profit for myself; or hurt, but as God will. Had I knowledge of the Unseen I would have acquired much good, and evil would not have touched me. I am only a warner, and a bearer of good tidings, to a people believing.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: I possess no power over benefit or hurt to myself save as Allah willeth; and had I knowledge of the unseen I would have amassed ample good, and evil would not have touched me. I am naught but a warner and a bringer of tidings unto a people who believe.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I possess no power of benefit or hurt to myself except as Allah wills. If I had the knowledge of the Ghaib (unseen), I should have secured for myself an abundance of wealth, and no evil should have touched me. I am but a warner, and a bringer of glad tidings unto people who believe."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “I have no control over any benefit or harm to myself, except as God wills. Had I known the future, I would have acquired much good, and no harm would have touched me. I am only a warner, and a herald of good news to a people who believe.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Tell them [O Muhammad]: 'I have no power to benefit or harm myself except as Allah may please. And had I knowledge of the unseen, I should have amassed all kinds of good, and no evil would have ever touched me. I am merely a warner and the herald of glad tidings to those who have faith.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "I possess no power over benefit or harm to myself except as Allah wills. If I had the knowledge of the Ghayb (Unseen), I should have secured for myself an abundance of wealth, and no evil should have touched me. I am but a warner, and a bringer of glad tidings unto people who believe."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: For myself I have no power to benefit, nor power to hurt, save that which Allah willeth. Had I knowledge of the Unseen, I should have abundance of wealth, and adversity would not touch me. I am but a warner, and a bearer of good tidings unto folk who believe.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘I have no control over any benefit for myself, nor [over] any harm except what Allah may wish. Had I known the Unseen, I would have acquired much good, and no ill would have befallen me. I am only a warner and bearer of good news to a people who have faith.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'I do not have the power to acquire benefits or to avert harm from myself, except by the Will of Allah. Had I possessed knowledge of the unseen, I would have availed myself of much that is good, and no harm would have touched me. But I am only a warner and a bearer of glad tidings for a nation who believe.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "I hold not for myself [the power of] benefit or harm, except what Allah has willed. And if I knew the unseen, I could have acquired much wealth, and no harm would have touched me. I am not except a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), say, "I have no control over my benefits or sufferings, without the will of God. Had I known about the unseen, I would have gained much good and would have faced no suffering. I am only a warner and I preach the glad news to the believing people."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: I do not control any benefit or harm for my own soul except as Allah please; and had I known the unseen I would have had much of good and no evil would have touched me; I am nothing but a warner and the giver of good news to a people who believe.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul la amliku linafsee nafAAan wala darran illa ma shaa Allahu walaw kuntu aAAlamu alghayba laistakthartu mina alkhayri wama massaniya alssooo in ana illa natheerun wabasheerun liqawmin yuminoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "I myself have no power to benefit or do harm, save as God pleases. If I had knowledge of the unseen, I would have availed myself of an abundance of good, and no harm would have touched me. I am but a warner and a bearer of good tidings for those who will believe."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "I have no power over any good or harm to myself except as Allah willeth. If I had knowledge of the unseen, I should have multiplied all good, and no evil should have touched me: I am but a warner, and a bringer of glad tidings to those who have faith."

verses.text: هُوَ الَّذِي‌ خَلَقَکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ نَفْسٍ‌ وَاحِدَةٍ وَ جَعَلَ‌ مِنْهَا زَوْجَهَا لِيَسْکُنَ‌ إِلَيْهَا فَلَمَّا تَغَشَّاهَا حَمَلَتْ‌ حَمْلاً خَفِيفاً فَمَرَّتْ‌ بِهِ‌ فَلَمَّا أَثْقَلَتْ‌ دَعَوَا اللَّهَ‌ رَبَّهُمَا لَئِنْ‌ آتَيْتَنَا صَالِحاً لَنَکُونَنَ‌ مِنَ‌ الشَّاکِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: او کسی است که شما را از یک تن آفرید، و همسرش را از او پدید آورد تا در کنارش آرامش یابد؛ پس هنگامی که مرد با زن آمیزش نمود، زن به حملی سبک حامله شد، پس با آن حمل سبک، زندگی را ادامه داد؛ پس چون سنگین بار شد، زن و شوهر پروردگارشان را خواندند که اگر به ما فرزندی تندرست و سالم عطا کنی، مسلماً از سپاس گزاران خواهیم بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اوست كه همه شما را از يك تن بيافريد. و از آن يك تن زنش را نيز بيافريد تا به او آرامش يابد. چون با او درآميخت، به بارى سبك بارور شد و مدتى با آن سر كرد. و چون بار سنگين گرديد، آن دو، اللّه پروردگار خويش را بخواندند كه اگر ما را فرزندى صالح دهى از سپاسگزاران خواهيم بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اوست كه شما را از نفس واحدى آفريد و جفت وى را از او پديد آورد تا بدان آرام گيرد. پس چون با او بياميخت، بارى سبك گرفت و با آن مدتى سر كرد. و چون سنگين شد، هر دو از خداوند، پروردگار خويش خواستند كه: اگر فرزند شايسته‌اى به ما دهى قطعا از سپاسگزاران خوا

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اوست آن كس كه شما را از نَفْس واحدى آفريد، و جفت وى را از آن پديد آورد تا بدان آرام گيرد. پس چون [آدم‌] با او [حوّا] درآميخت باردار شد، بارى سبك. و [چندى‌] با آن [بار سبك‌] گذرانيد، و چون سنگين‌بار شد، خدا، پروردگار خود را خواندند كه اگر به ما [فرزندى‌] شايسته عطا كنى قطعاً از سپاسگزاران خواهيم بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اوست خدایی که همه شما را از یک تن بیافرید و از (نوع) او نیز جفتش را مقرر داشت تا به او انس و آرام گیرد، و چون با او خلوت کرد باری سبک برداشت، پس با آن بار حمل چندی بزیست تا سنگین شد، آن‌گاه هر دو خدا و پروردگار خود را خواندند که اگر به ما فرزندی صالح (و تندرست) عطا کردی البته از شکرگزاران خواهیم بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او آن کسی است که شما را از یک جنس آفرید، و همسران شما را از جنس شما ساخت تا شوهران در کنار همسران بیاسایند. ولی (بسیار اتّفاق می‌افتد که) هنگامی که شوهران با همسران آمیزش جنسی می‌کنند، همسران بار سبکی (به نام جنین) برمی‌دارند و به آسانی با آن روزگار را بسر می‌برند. امّا هنگامی که بار آنان سنگین می‌شود، شوهران و همسران خدای خود را فریاد می‌دارند و می‌گویند: اگر فرزند سالم و شایسته‌ای به ما عطاء فرمائی از زمره سپاسگزاران خواهیم بود. [[«نَفْسٍ واحِدَةٍ»: مراد نسل و نوع انسانها است (نگا: روم / 21) به عبارت دیگر، در اینجا واحد نوعی موردنظر است؛ نه واحد شخصی. «تَغَشّاها»: با او همبستر شد. «مَرَّتْ بِهِ»: او را برد. مراد این است که وجود آن سنگینی نکرد و در انجام کارها وقفه‌ای ایجاد ننمود. «أَثْقَلَتْ»: به سبب بزرگ شدن جنین، سنگین شد. «صَالِحاً»: شایسته. مراد فرزندی است که شایسته زندگی بوده و سالم و تندرست باشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: او کسی است که شما را از تن یگانه‌ای آفرید و همسرش را از او پدید آورد تا در کنار او آرام گیرد، و چون [آدم‌] با او [حوا] آمیزش کرد، باری سبک گرفت و با آن آسان به سر می‌برد و چون گرانبار شد، هردو خداوند، پروردگارشان را به دعا خواندند که اگر به ما فرزند سالم و شایسته‌ای عطا کنی از سپاسگزاران خواهیم بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او خدایی است که (همه) شما را از یک فرد آفرید؛ و همسرش را نیز از جنس او قرار داد، تا در کنار او بیاساید. سپس هنگامی که با او آمیزش کرد، حملی سبک برداشت، که با وجود آن، به کارهای خود ادامه می‌داد؛ و چون سنگین شد، هر دو از خداوند و پروردگار خود خواستند «اگر فرزند صالحی به ما دهی، از شاکران خواهیم بود!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: او است آنکه آفرید شما را از یک تن و قرار داد از او جفتش را تا آرامش گیرد بدو سپس هنگامی که بر او درآمد برداشت باری سبک پس بگذشت بر آن تا گاهی که سنگین شد خواندند پروردگار خویش را که اگر ما را صالحی (شایسته) دهی باشیم از شکرگزاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اوست كه شما را از يك تن آفريد و همسر او را از [نوع‌] او پديد كرد تا بدو آرام گيرد. و چون بر او در آمد بار گرفت بارى سبك، پس با آن [مدتى‌] گذرانيد. و چون گرانبار گشت، آن دو پروردگار خويش را خواندند كه اگر ما را فرزندى نيك و شايسته- تندرست- دهى بى‌گمان از سپاسگزاران خواهيم بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: اوست کسی که شما را از نفس واحدی آفرید و جفت وی را (نیز) از آن پدید آورد تا بدان آرام گیرد. پس چون (نسل وی) زنانی را باردار کردند، خدا، پروردگار خود را خواندند که: «اگر به ما (فرزندی) شایسته عطا کنی بی‌گمان از سپاسگزاران خواهیم بود.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is He who created you from a single cell, and from it created its mate, that you may live as companions. When the man covered the woman she conceived a light burden and carried it about. And when she was heavy (with child) they prayed together to their Lord: "If You bestow a healthy son on us we shall truly be grateful."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: It is He Who created you from a single soul, and from him made its mate for him to gain comfort with her; so when the male covered her, she was burdened lightly in her womb, and she therefore moved easily carrying it; and when she felt the burden heavy, they both cried to their Lord Allah, “Indeed You may give to us a child as You will, so we will surely be thankful.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It is He who created you out of one living soul, and made of him his spouse that he might rest in her. Then, when he covered her, she bore a light burden and passed by with it; but when it became heavy they cried to God their Lord, 'If Thou givest us a righteous son, we indeed shall be of the thankful.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He it is who created you from a single soul, and He created therefrom his spouse that he might find repose in her. Then when he covereth her she beareth a light burthen and fareth about there with; then when she groweth heavy the twain call upon Allah their Lord: if Thou vouchsafest us a goodly Child, we shall surely be of the thankful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: It is He Who has created you from a single person (Adam), and (then) He has created from him his wife [Hawwa (Eve)], in order that he might enjoy the pleasure of living with her. When he had sexual relation with her, she became pregnant and she carried it about lightly. Then when it became heavy, they both invoked Allah, their Lord (saying): "If You give us a Salih (good in every aspect) child, we shall indeed be among the grateful."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is He who created you from a single person, and made from it its mate, that he may find comfort with her. Then, when he has covered her, she conceives a light load, and she carries it around. But when she has grown heavy, they pray to God their Lord, “if You give us a good child, we will be among the thankful.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It is He - Allah -Who created you from a single being, and out of it He made its mate, that he may find comfort in her. And when he covers her, she bears a light burden and goes about with it. Then, when she grows heavy, they pray to their Lord: 'If You bestow upon us a healthy child, we will surely give thanks.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: It is He Who has created you from a single person, and (then) He has created from him his wife, in order that he might enjoy the pleasure of living with her. When he covered [had sexual relation with] her, she became pregnant and she carried it about (lightly). Then when it became heavy, they both invoked Allah, their Lord (saying): "If You give us a Salih (good in every aspect) child, we shall indeed be among the grateful."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He it is Who did create you from a single soul, and therefrom did make his mate that he might take rest in her. And when he covered her she bore a light burden, and she passed (unnoticed) with it, but when it became heavy they cried unto Allah, their Lord, saying: If thou givest unto us aright we shall be of the thankful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is He who created you from a single soul, and made from it its mate, that he might find comfort with her. So when he had covered her, she bore a light burden and passed [some time] with it. When she had grown heavy, they both invoked Allah, their Lord: ‘If You give us a healthy [child], we will be surely grateful.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It is He who created you from a soul. From it He created its mate, so that he might reside with her. And when he had covered her, she conceived, and for a time her burden was light. She carried it with ease, but when it grew heavy, they both supplicated to Allah, their Lord: 'Grant us a goodly child and we will be among the thankful'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: It is He who created you from one soul and created from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her. And when he covers her, she carries a light burden and continues therein. And when it becomes heavy, they both invoke Allah, their Lord, "If You should give us a good [child], we will surely be among the grateful."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is God Who created you from a single soul and out of it made its spouse to bring it comfort. When he (man) engaged in carnal relations with her, she conceived a light burden which she had to carry. When the baby grew in her womb, they (husband and wife) both prayed to their Lord, "If You grant us a healthy son we shall certainly give you thanks."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He it is Who created you from a single being, and of the same (kind) did He make his mate, that he might incline to her; so when he covers her she bears a light burden, then moves about with it; but when it grows heavy, they both call upon Allah, their Lord: If Thou givest us a good one, we shall certainly be of the grateful ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Huwa allathee khalaqakum min nafsin wahidatin wajaAAala minha zawjaha liyaskuna ilayha falamma taghashshaha hamalat hamlan khafeefan famarrat bihi falamma athqalat daAAawa Allaha rabbahuma lain ataytana salihan lanakoonanna mina alshshakireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It was He who created you from a single soul, and from it made its mate so that he may find comfort in her. Once he has covered her, she conceives and goes about with a light burden. When it grows  heavy, they both call to God, their Lord, "If You bestow on us a healthy child, we will surely be grateful,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: It is He Who created you from a single person, and made his mate of like nature, in order that he might dwell with her (in love). When they are united, she bears a light burden and carries it about (unnoticed). When she grows heavy, they both pray to Allah their Lord, (saying): "If Thou givest us a goodly child, we vow we shall (ever) be grateful."

verses.text: فَلَمَّا آتَاهُمَا صَالِحاً جَعَلاَ لَهُ‌ شُرَکَاءَ فِيمَا آتَاهُمَا فَتَعَالَى‌ اللَّهُ‌ عَمَّا يُشْرِکُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هنگامی که به آن زن و شوهر فرزندی تندرست و سالم داد [غیر از خدا را در اعطای این نعمت مؤثر دانستند، از این جهت] برای خدا در کنار نعمتی که به آنان عطا کرده بود، شریکان وهمتایانی قرار دادند!! پس خدا برتر و والاتر از آن است که برایش شریکان و همتایان قرار دهند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون خدا آن دو را فرزندى صالح داد، براى او در آنچه به آنها عطا كرده بود شريكانى انگاشتند، حال آنكه خدا از هر چه با او شريك مى‌سازند برتر است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اما هنگامى كه فرزند [سالم و] شايسته‌اى به آنها داد، براى خدا در موهبتى كه داده بود شريكانى قائل شدند، ولى خدا از آنچه شريك او مى‌كنند بالاتر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چون به آن دو، [فرزندى‌] شايسته داد، در آنچه [خدا] به ايشان داده بود، براى او شريكانى قرار دادند، و خدا از آنچه [با او] شريك مى‌گردانند برتر است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس چون به آن پدر و مادر فرزندی صالح (و تندرست) عطا کرد مشرک شدند و برای خدا در آنچه به آنها عطا کرد شریک قرار دادند (یعنی فرزندان خود را به نام بتها نامیدند مثل عبد اللات و عبد العزی)، و خدای تعالی برتر است از آنچه شریک او سازند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: امّا وقتی که خداوند فرزند سالم و شایسته‌ای بدانان داد، در دادن آن، چیزهائی (از قبیل: قبور اولیاء و صلحاء، و اشخاص و اصنام) را انباز خدا می‌سازند، و خدا بس بالاتر از آن است که همسان انبازهای ایشان شود. [[«فِیمَا»: در اعطاء. واژه (ما) می‌تواند مصدری و به معنی: دادن، و یا این که موصول و به معنی: خداداد باشد. «عَمَّا»: از کاری که. از چیز یا چیزهائی که. واژه (ما) مصدری یا موصول است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون به آن دو، فرزندی سالم و شایسته عطا کرد، آن دو در عطای او، برای او شریکانی قائل شدند، ولی خداوند از آنچه شرک می‌آورند منزه است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اما هنگامی که خداوند فرزند صالحی به آنها داد، (موجودات دیگر را در این موهبت مؤثر دانستند؛ و) برای خدا، در این نعمت که به آنها بخشیده بود، همتایانی قائل شدند؛ خداوند برتر است از آنچه همتای او قرار می‌دهند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: ولی هنگامی که داد بدیشان صالحی (شایسته) و قرار دادند شریکانی برای او در آنچه بدیشان داد همانا برتر است خدا از آنچه شرک می‌ورزند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون آن دو را فرزندى نيك و شايسته- تندرست- داد در آنچه ايشان را بداد براى او شريكانى قرار دادند همانا خدا از آنچه [با او] شريك مى‌سازند برتر است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چون به آن دو، فرزندی شایسته داد، در آنچه (خدا) به ایشان داده بود، برای او شریکانی قرار دادند. پس خدا از آنچه (با او) شریک می‌گردانند برتر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But when they were given a healthy son, they started ascribing to other powers a share in what God had bestowed on them. But God is above what they ascribe to Him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So when He bestowed them a normal child, they ascribed partners (to Him) in respect of what He had bestowed upon them; therefore Supreme is Allah, above all that they ascribe as partners.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Thereafter, when He gave them a righteous son, they assigned Him associates in that He had given them; but God is high exalted above that they associate.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: But when He vouchsafeth the twain a goodly child they set up unto Him associates in respect of that which He hath vouchsafed to them. Exalted be Allah far from that which they associate!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But when He gave them a Salih (good in every aspect) child, they ascribed partners to Him (Allah) in that which He has given to them. High be Allah, Exalted above all that they ascribe as partners to Him. (Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 9, Page 148).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But when He has given them a good child, they attribute partners to Him in what He has given them. God is exalted above what they associate.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But when He vouchsafes them a healthy child, they attribute to Him partners regarding what Allah had bestowed upon them. Subliminally exalted is Allah above that which they associate with Him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But when He gave them a Salih child, they ascribed partners to Him (Allah) in that which He has given to them. High be Allah, Exalted above all that they ascribe as partners to Him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But when He gave unto them aright, they ascribed unto Him partners in respect of that which He had given them. High is He Exalted above all that they associate (with Him).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then when He gave them a healthy [child], they ascribed partners to Him in what He had given them. Exalted is Allah above [having] any partners that they ascribe [to Him]!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Yet when He gave both of them (the parents) a goodly child, they set up associates with Him, in return for what He had given them. Exalted be Allah above that they associate with Him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But when He gives them a good [child], they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them. Exalted is Allah above what they associate with Him.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When they were given a healthy son, they began to love him as much as they loved God. God is too exalted to be loved equally to anything else.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But when He gives them a good one, they set up with Him associates in what He has given them; but high is Allah above what they associate (with Him).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma atahuma salihan jaAAala lahu shurakaa feema atahuma fataAAala Allahu AAamma yushrikoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: yet when He grants them a healthy child, they begin to ascribe to others a share in the gift they have received. But God is far above what they associate with Him!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But when He giveth them a goodly child, they ascribe to others a share in the gift they have received: but Allah is exalted high above the partners they ascribe to Him.

verses.text: أَ يُشْرِکُونَ‌ مَا لاَ يَخْلُقُ‌ شَيْئاً وَ هُمْ‌ يُخْلَقُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا موجوداتی را شریک او قرار می دهند که قدرت ندارند کمترین چیزی را بیافرینند و خودشان آفریده می شوند؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا شريك خدا مى‌سازند چيزهايى را كه نمى‌توانند هيچ چيز بيافرينند و خود مخلوق هستند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا موجوداتى را شريك او مى‌سازند كه چيزى نمى‌آفرينند و خود آفريده مى‌شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا موجوداتى را [با او] شريك مى‌گردانند كه چيزى را نمى‌آفرينند و خودشان مخلوقند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا این چیزهایی را که هیچ موجود را خلق نتوانند کرد و خود مخلوق (خدا) هستند شریک خدا قرار می‌دهند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا چیزهائی را انباز خدا می‌سازند که نمی‌توانند چیزی را بیافرینند و بلکه خودشان هم آفریده می‌شوند؟ [[«لا یَخْلُقُ ... یُخْلَقُونَ»: ذکر فعل نخست به صورت مفرد، به خاطر رعایت لفظ (ما) و ذکر فعل دوم به صورت جمع، به خاطر رعایت معنی آن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا چیزهایی را شریک او می‌آورند که چیزی نمی‌آفرینند و خود آفریده شده‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا موجوداتی را همتای او قرارمی‌دهند که چیزی را نمی‌آفرینند، و خودشان مخلوقند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا شریک کنند آنان را که نیافرند چیزی را و خود آفریده شوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا چيزهايى را [با خدا] شريك مى‌سازند كه هيچ چيزى را نمى‌آفرينند و خود آفريده مى‌شوند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا چیزی را (با او) شریک می‌کنند که چیزی را نمی‌آفریند، حال آنکه خودشان (هم) آفریده می‌شوند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do they associate those with Him who cannot create a thing, and are themselves created,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Do they (the disbelievers) ascribe (false deities) that which do not create anything, but are themselves created?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, do they associate that which creates nothing and themselves are created,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Associate they those who cannot create aught and are created?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Do they attribute as partners to Allah those who created nothing but they themselves are created?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do they idolize those who create nothing, and are themselves created?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do they associate (with Allah in His divinity) those who can create nothing; rather, they are themselves created?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do they attribute as partners to Allah those who created nothing but they themselves are created

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Attribute they as partners to Allah those who created naught, but are themselves created,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they ascribe [to Him] partners that create nothing and have been created themselves,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Will they associate that which cannot create a thing while they are created?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and they are [themselves] created?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they (the pagans) consider things that do not create anything but are themselves created equal to God?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What! they associate (with Him) that which does not create any thing, while they are themselves created!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ayushrikoona ma la yakhluqu shayan wahum yukhlaqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and are themselves created?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Do they indeed ascribe to Him as partners things that can create nothing, but are themselves created?

verses.text: وَ لاَ يَسْتَطِيعُونَ‌ لَهُمْ‌ نَصْراً وَ لاَ أَنْفُسَهُمْ‌ يَنْصُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [این شریکانی که برای خدا قرار می دهند] نه می توانند پرستش کنندگان خود را یاری دهند، ونه قدرت دارند خودشان را یاری کنند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه مى‌توانند ياريشان كنند و نه مى‌توانند به يارى خود برخيزند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و نه مى‌توانند آنها را يارى دهند و نه خودشان را يارى كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و نمى‌توانند آنان را يارى كنند و نه خويشتن را يارى دهند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در صورتی که آنها نه هرگز به مشرکان و نه به خود یاری توانند کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: انبازهای آنان نه می‌توانند ایشان را یاری دهند و نه می‌توانند خویشتن را کمک نمایند.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و نمی‌توانند به ایشان و نه به خودشان یاری‌ای برسانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و نمی‌توانند آنان را یاری کنند، و نه خودشان را یاری می‌دهند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نتوانندشان یاریی و نه خویشتن را یاری‌ای کنند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و نه مى‌توانند آنان را يارى دهند و نه خودشان را يارى توانند كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و نمی‌توانند آنان را یاری کنند و نه خویشتن را یاری دهند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who can neither help them, nor help themselves?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And cannot provide any help to them, nor do they help themselves?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and that have no power to help them, neither they help themselves?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And who cannot succour them, nor can succour themselves.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: No help can they give them, nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And can neither help them, nor help their own selves?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They have no power to help others. nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: No help can they give them, nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And cannot give them help, nor can they help themselves?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and can neither help them, nor help themselves?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They cannot help them, nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the false deities are unable to [give] them help, nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The idols are things that are not able to help others or even themselves.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they have no power to give them help, nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala yastateeAAoona lahum nasran wala anfusahum yansuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They can give them no help, nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: No aid can they give them, nor can they aid themselves!

verses.text: وَ إِنْ‌ تَدْعُوهُمْ‌ إِلَى‌ الْهُدَى‌ لاَ يَتَّبِعُوکُمْ‌ سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْکُمْ‌ أَ دَعَوْتُمُوهُمْ‌ أَمْ‌ أَنْتُمْ‌ صَامِتُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر آن شریکان را به سوی هدایت بخوانید، از شما پیروی نمی کنند، برای شما یکسان است که آنان را بخوانید یا خاموش باشید [در هر صورت چیزی از آنان نصیب شما نمی شود.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر آنها را به راه هدايت بخوانى، از شما پيروى نخواهند كرد. برايتان يكسان است چه دعوتشان كنيد و چه خاموشى پيشه سازيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر آنها را به هدايت دعوت كنيد از شما پيروى نمى‌كنند. چه آنها را بخوانيد يا خاموش باشيد، بر شما يكسان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر آنها را به [راه‌] هدايت فراخوانيد، از شما پيروى نمى‌كنند. چه آنها را بخوانيد يا خاموش بمانيد، براى شما يكسان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر آنها را (یعنی بت‌پرستان را) به راه هدایت بخوانید پیروی شما (مؤمنان) نخواهند کرد، بر شما یکسان است که آنها را بخوانید یا خاموش بمانید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای بت‌پرستان!) شما اگر انبازهای خود را به فریاد خوانید تا شما را هدایت کنند، پاسخ شما را نمی‌توانند بدهند و خواسته‌ی شما را برآورده کنند. برای شما یکسان است، خواه آنها را به فریاد خوانید، و خواه خاموش باشید (و آنها را به یاری نطلبید. در هر دو صورت تکانی و کمکی از آنها نمی‌بینید). [[«إِن تَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَی الْهُدَی لا یَتَّبِعُوکُمْ»: اگر شما از آنها تقاضای هدایت کنید، تقاضای شما برآورده نمی‌شود. اگر شما بخواهید آنها را هدایت کنید، از شما پیروی نمی‌کنند. «صَامِتُونَ»: جمع صامت به معنی خاموش.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر ایشان را به [راه‌] هدایت بخوانید از شما پیروی نمی‌کنند، برای شما یکسان است، چه ایشان را بخوانید چه آنکه خاموش باشید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هرگاه آنها را به سوی هدایت دعوت کنید، از شما پیروی نمی‌کنند؛ و برای شما یکسان است چه آنها را دعوت کنید و چه خاموش باشید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر بسوی هدایتشان خوانید پیرویتان نکنند یکسان است بر شما بخوانید ایشان را یا باشید خموشان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر [شما مشركان‌] آنها- بُتان- را به راه راست بخوانيد شما را پيروى نكنند. بر شما يكسان است كه آنها را بخوانيد يا خاموش باشيد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اگر آنها را به راه (راست) فراخوانید، از شما پیروی نمی‌کنند؛ چه آنها را بخوانید یا خاموش بمانید، بر شما یکسان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: If you call them to guidance they will not follow you. It is all the same if you call them or hold your tongue.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And if you call the disbelievers to guidance, they do not follow you; it is the same for you, whether you invite them or remain silent.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: If you call them to guidance they will not follow you; equal it is to you whether you call them, or whether you are silent.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And if ye call them toward guidance they follow you not: it is the same to you whether ye call them or are silent.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And if you call them to guidance, they follow you not. It is the same for you whether you call them or you keep silent.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And if you invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is the same for you, whether you invite them, or remain silent.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And if you call them to true guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you call them to true guidance or keep silent.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And if you call them to guidance, they follow you not. It is the same for you whether you call them or you keep silent.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And if ye call them to the Guidance, they follow you not. Whether ye call them or are silent is all one for you.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: If you call them to guidance, they will not follow you: it is the same to you whether you call them or whether you are silent.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: If you call them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is the same whether you call them or you are silent.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And if you [believers] invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you invite them or you are silent.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Believers, even if you invite them to true guidance, they will not follow you. It makes no difference whether you invite them or whether you keep quiet.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And if you invite them to guidance, they will not follow you; it is the same to you whether you invite them or you are silent.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wain tadAAoohum ila alhuda la yattabiAAookum sawaon AAalaykum adaAAawtumoohum am antum samitoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It makes no difference whether you call on them or remain silent. If you call them to the right path, they will not follow you.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: If ye call them to guidance, they will not obey: For you it is the same whether ye call them or ye hold your peace!

verses.text: إِنَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ تَدْعُونَ‌ مِنْ‌ دُونِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ عِبَادٌ أَمْثَالُکُمْ‌ فَادْعُوهُمْ‌ فَلْيَسْتَجِيبُوا لَکُمْ‌ إِنْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ صَادِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یقیناً کسانی را که به جای خدا می پرستید بندگان و مملوکانی ناتوانْ چون شما هستند؛ پس اگر راستگویید [که می توانند در زندگی شما مؤثر باشند] آنان را [در گرفتاری ها و نیازمندی های خود] بخوانید پس [هنگامی که بخوانید [باید شما را اجابت کنند] ولی خود می دانید که در هیچ موردی جواب شما را نمی دهند.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنهايى كه جز اللّه به خدايى مى‌خوانيد، بندگانى چون شمايند. اگر راست مى‌گوييد، آنها را بخوانيد، بايد شما را اجابت كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا كسانى را كه سواى خدا مى‌خوانيد بندگانى مانند شمايند. پس آنها را بخوانيد، و اگر راست مى‌گوييد بايد شما را پاسخ دهند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت، كسانى را كه به جاى خدا مى‌خوانيد، بندگانى امثال شما هستند. پس آنها را [در گرفتاريها] بخوانيد، اگر راست مى‌گوييد بايد شما را اجابت كنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: غیر خدا هر آن کس را که شما (مشرکان و یهود و نصاری) به خدایی می‌خوانید (مانند بتان و عیسی و عُزَیر و غیره) به حقیقت همه مثل شما بندگانی هستند، اگر راستگویید آنها را بخوانید تا مشکلات و حوائج شما را روا کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بتهائی را که بجز خدا فریاد می‌دارید و می‌پرستید، بندگانی همچون خود شما هستند (و کاری از آنان ساخته نیست و نمی‌توانند فریادرس شما باشند). آنان را به فریاد خوانید و (از ایشان استمداد جوئید) اگر راست می‌گوئید (که کاری از ایشان ساخته است) باید که به شما پاسخ دهند (و نیاز شما را برآورده کنند). [[«إِنَّ الّذِینَ تَدْعُونَ»: کسانی را که به کمک می‌طلبید و به فریاد می‌خوانید. بتهائی را که فریاد می‌دارید و می‌پرستید. «تَدْعُونَ»: صدا می‌زنید و به فریاد می‌خوانید. می‌پرستید. «عِبَادٌ»: مراد کسانی است که ندا می‌گردند و به کمک خوانده می‌شوند. یا مراد اصنام جمادی است که بنا به عقیده بت‌پرستان واژه‌های خاصّ ذوی‌العقول، یعنی (الَّذِینَ) و (عِبَادٌ) برای آنها به کار رفته است، و به حکم تکوین فرمانبردار خدایند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: کسانی را که در برابر و به جای خداوند می‌خوانید بندگانی مانند شما هستند، بخوانیدشان و اگر راست می‌گویید باید که پاسخ شما را بدهند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنهایی را که غیر از خدا می‌خوانید (و پرستش می‌کنید)، بندگانی همچون خود شما هستند؛ آنها را بخوانید، و اگر راست می‌گویید باید به شما پاسخ دهند (و تقاضایتان را برآورند)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا آنان را که جز خدا می‌خوانید بندگانیند مانند شما پس بخوانیدشان تا اجابت کنند شما را اگر هستید راستگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا كسانى را كه به جاى خداى يكتا مى‌خوانيد بندگانى- آفريدگانى- مانند شمايند. پس آنها را بخوانيد كه اگر راستگوييد بايد شما را پاسخ دهند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: کسانی را که به جای خدا می‌خوانید، بی‌گمان بندگانی همانند شمایند. پس آنها را (در بد و خوب) بخوانید. اگر راست می‌گویید باید شما را اجابت کنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Those whom you invoke besides God are created beings like you. So call on them and let them answer your call, if what you say is true.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed those whom you (the disbelievers) worship besides Allah are slaves like you – so call them and they may answer you, if you are truthful!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Those on whom you call apart from God, are servants the likes of you; call them and let them answer you, if you speak truly.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily those whom ye call upon beside Allah are creatures like unto you; so call on them, and let them answer you if ye say sooth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, those whom you call upon besides Allah are slaves like you. So call upon them and let them answer you if you are truthful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those you call upon besides God are servants like you. So call upon them, and let them answer you, if you are truthful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Those whom you invoke other than Allah are creatures like you. So invoke them. and see if they answer your call, if what you claim is true.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, those whom you call upon besides Allah are servants like you. So call upon them and let them answer you if you are truthful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! those on whom ye call beside Allah are slaves like unto you. Call on them now, and let them answer you, if ye are truthful!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed those whom you invoke besides Allah are creatures like you. So invoke them: they should answer you, if you are truthful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Those whom you invoke, other than Allah, are worshipers like yourselves. Call them, and let them answer you, if what you say is true!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, those you [polytheists] call upon besides Allah are servants like you. So call upon them and let them respond to you, if you should be truthful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Those whom you (pagans) worship besides God, are themselves servants just like yourselves. If your claim was true, they should answer your prayers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely those whom you call on besides Allah are in a state of subjugation like yourselves; therefore call on them, then let them answer you if you are truthful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna allatheena tadAAoona min dooni Allahi AAibadun amthalukum faodAAoohum falyastajeeboo lakum in kuntum sadiqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Those whom you call on besides God are but creatures like yourselves. Call upon them, then, and let them respond to you, if what you say is true.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily those whom ye call upon besides Allah are servants like unto you: Call upon them, and let them listen to your prayer, if ye are (indeed) truthful!

verses.text: أَ لَهُمْ‌ أَرْجُلٌ‌ يَمْشُونَ‌ بِهَا أَمْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ أَيْدٍ يَبْطِشُونَ‌ بِهَا أَمْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ أَعْيُنٌ‌ يُبْصِرُونَ‌ بِهَا أَمْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ آذَانٌ‌ يَسْمَعُونَ‌ بِهَا قُلِ‌ ادْعُوا شُرَکَاءَکُمْ‌ ثُمَ‌ کِيدُونِ‌ فَلاَ تُنْظِرُونِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا آنها پاهایی دارند که با آن راه روند، یا دست هایی دارند که با آن بگیرند، یا چشم هایی دارند که با آن ببینند، یا گوش هایی دارند که با آن بشنوند؟! بگو: شریکان خود را [به کمک خویش] بخوانید، سپس [بر ضدِّ من هر توطئه و] نیرنگی [دارید] به کار گیرید و [برای نابودی من لحظه ای مرا [مهلت ندهید] تا برای شما ثابت شود که هیچ کاری در هیچ زمینه ای از غیر خدا بر نمی آید.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آنها را پاهايى هست كه با آن راه بروند يا آنها را دستهايى هست كه با آن حمله كنند يا چشمهايى هست كه با آن ببينند يا گوشهايى هست كه با آن بشنوند؟ بگو: شريكانتان را بخوانيد و بر ضد من تدبير كنيد و مرا مهلت مدهيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا پاهايى دارند كه با آن راه روند؟ يا دست‌هايى دارند كه با آن كارى كنند؟ يا چشمانى دارند كه با آن ببينند؟ و يا گوش‌هايى دارند كه با آن بشنوند؟ بگو: شركاى خود را بخوانيد، سپس در حق من [هر چه مى‌توانيد] نيرنگ كنيد و مهلتم ندهيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا آنها پاهايى دارند كه با آن راه بروند، يا دستهايى دارند كه با آن كارى انجام دهند، يا چشمهايى دارند كه با آن بنگرند، يا گوشهايى دارند كه با آن بشنوند؟ بگو: «شريكان خود را بخوانيد؛ سپس در باره من حيله به كار بريد و مرا مهلت مدهيد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آن بتان را پایی است که راهی پیمایند یا دستی که از آستین قدرت بیرون آرند، یا چشم و گوشی که به آن ببینند و بشنوند؟ بگو: شریکان (باطل) خود را بخوانید و هر حیلت که با من می‌توانید به کار برید بی‌آنکه هیچ مرا مهلت بدهید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا این بتها دارای پاهائی هستند که با آنها راه بروند؟ یا دارای دستهائی هستند که با آنها چیزی را برگیرند (و دفع بلا از شما و خویشتن کنند؟) یا چشمهائی دارند که با آنها ببینند؟ یا گوشهائی دارند که با آنها بشنوند؟ (پس آنها نه تنها با شما برابر نیستند، بلکه از شما هم کمتر و ناتوانترند. در این صورت چگونه آنها را انباز خدا می‌کنید و آنها را می‌پرستید؟). بگو: این بتهائی را که شریک خدا می‌دانید فراخوانید و سپس شما و آنها همراه یکدیگر درباره‌ی من نیرنگ و چاره‌جوئی کنید و اصلاً مرا مهلت ندهید (و اگر می‌توانید غضبم کنید و نابودم گردانید. امّا بدانید که اینها موجودات غیر مؤثّری هستند و کمترین تأثیری در وضع من و شما ندارند). [[«یَبْطِشُونَ بِهَا»: آنچه بخواهند با آنها برمی‌دارند. با آنها دفع بلا می‌کنند. «کِیدُونِ»: برای نابودیم نقشه بکشید و مکر و کید کنید. چاره مرا بسازید. «لا تُنظِرُونِ»: مرا فرصت ندهید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا پاهایی دارند که با آن راه روند؟ یا دستانی دارند که با آن کاری انجام دهند، یا چشمانی دارند که با آن ببینند؟ یا گوشهایی دارند که با آن بشنوند؟ بگو شریکانی را که قائلید بخوانید، سپس در حق من هرچه خواهید بسگالید و مرا مهلت ندهید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا (آنها حداقل همانند خود شما) پاهایی دارند که با آن راه بروند؟! یا دستهایی دارند که با آن چیزی را بگیرند (و کاری انجام دهند)؟! یا چشمانی دارند که با آن ببینند؟! یا گوشهایی دارند که با آن بشنوند؟! (نه، هرگز، هیچ‌کدام،) بگو: «(اکنون که چنین است،) بتهای خویش را که شریک خدا قرار داده‌اید (بر ضد من) بخوانید، و برای من نقشه بکشید، و لحظه‌ای مهلت ندهید، (تا بدانید کاری از آنها ساخته نیست)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا آنان را است پاهائی که روان گردند بدانها یا آنان را است دستهائی که آهنگ کنند بدانها یا آنان را است دیدگانی که بینند بدانها یا آنان را است گوشهائی که بشنوند بدانها بگو بخوانید شریکان خویش را پس نیرنگ با من کنید و مهلتم ندهید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا آنها را پاهايى هست كه با آن بروند، يا آنها را دستهايى هست كه با آن بگيرند- داد و ستد و حمله و دفاع كنند-، يا آنها را چشمهايى هست كه با آن ببينند، يا آنها را گوشهايى هست كه با آن بشنوند. بگو: انبازان خود را- كه براى خدا ساخته‌ايد- بخوانيد آنگاه در باره من هر ترفند و نيرنگى كه توانيد به كار بريد و مرا مهلت مدهيد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا برایشان پاهایی است که با آنها راه می‌روند، یا دست‌هایی دارند که با آنها حمله‌ور می‌شوند، یا چشم‌هایی دارند که با آنها می‌نگرند، یا گوش‌هایی دارند که با آنها می‌شنوند؟ بگو: «شریکانتان را بخوانید، سپس درباره‌ی من حیله‌ای (ناروا) کنید. پس مرا مهلت ندهید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do they have feet to walk on, or hands to hold with, or eyes to see and ears to hear with? Say to them: "Call your compeers, and work out a plot against me, and do not give me time.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Do they have feet to walk with? Or have they hands to hold with? Or have they eyes to see with? Or have they ears to hear with? Say, “Call upon your ascribed partners and conspire against me, and do not give me respite.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, have they feet wherewith they walk, or have they hands wherewith they lay hold, or have they eyes wherewith they see, or have they ears wherewith they give ear? Say: 'Call you then to your associates; then try your guile on me, and give me no respite.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Have they feet wherewith they wend? Have they hands wherewith they grip? Have they eyes wherewith they see? Have they ears wherewith they hearken? Say thou: call upon your associate gods, and then plot against me and respite me not.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Have they feet wherewith they walk? Or have they hands wherewith they hold? Or have they eyes wherewith they see? Or have they ears wherewith they hear? Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Call your (so-called) partners (of Allah) and then plot against me, and give me no respite!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do they have feet with which they walk? Or do they have hands with which they strike? Or do they have eyes with which they see? Or do they have ears with which they hear? Say, “Call upon your partners, then plot against me, and do not wait.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Have they feet on which they can walk? Have they hands with which they can grasp? Have they eyes with which they can see? Have they ears with which they can hear? Say [O Muhammad]: 'Invoke all those to whom you ascribe a share in Allah's divinity, then scheme against me and grant me no respite.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Have they feet wherewith they walk Or have they hands wherewith they hold Or have they eyes wherewith they see Or have they ears wherewith they hear Say: "Call your (so-called) partners (of Allah) and then plot against me, and give me no respite!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Have they feet wherewith they walk, or have they hands wherewith they hold, or have they eyes wherewith they see, or have they ears wherewith they hear? Say: Call upon your (so-called) partners (of Allah), and then contrive against me, spare me not!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they have any feet to walk with? Do they have any hands to grasp with? Do they have any eyes to see with? Do they have any ears to hear with? Say, ‘Invoke your partners [that you ascribe to Allah] and try out your stratagems against me without granting me any respite.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have they feet to walk with? Have they hands to punish with? Have they eyes to see with? Have they ears to hear with? Say: 'Call on your partners and then try to scheme against me. Give me no respite.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Do they have feet by which they walk? Or do they have hands by which they strike? Or do they have eyes by which they see? Or do they have ears by which they hear? Say, [O Muhammad], "Call your 'partners' and then conspire against me and give me no respite.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they (the idols) have feet to walk, hands to hold things, eyes to see, and ears to hear? (Muhammad), tell them (the pagans) to call on their idols for help and to plan against Me without delay.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Have they feet with which they walk, or have they hands with which they hold, or have they eyes with which they see, or have they ears with which they hear? Say: Call your associates, then make a struggle (to prevail) against me and give me no respite.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alahum arjulun yamshoona biha am lahum aydin yabtishoona biha am lahum aAAyunun yubsiroona biha am lahum athanun yasmaAAoona biha quli odAAoo shurakaakum thumma keedooni fala tunthirooni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have they feet to walk with? Have they hands to hold with? Have they eyes to see with? Have they ears to hear with? Say, "Call upon those you associate with God as partners, then all of you contrive against me and give me no respite.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Have they feet to walk with? Or hands to lay hold with? Or eyes to see with? Or ears to hear with? Say: "Call your 'god-partners', scheme (your worst) against me, and give me no respite!

verses.text: إِنَ‌ وَلِيِّيَ‌ اللَّهُ‌ الَّذِي‌ نَزَّلَ‌ الْکِتَابَ‌ وَ هُوَ يَتَوَلَّى‌ الصَّالِحِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یقیناً سرپرست و یار من خدایی است که قرآن را نازل کرده و او همواره شایستگان را سرپرستی و یاری می کند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ياور من اللّه است كه اين كتاب را نازل كرده و او دوست شايستگان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌ترديد سرپرست من خداوند است كه اين كتاب را نازل كرده و او شايستگان را سرپرستى مى‌كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بى‌ترديد، سرور من آن خدايى است كه قرآن را فرو فرستاده، و همو دوستدار شايستگان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مرا دوست و یاور به حقیقت خدایی است که این کتاب (قرآن) را فرستاده و اوست که نیکوکاران را دوستی و سرپرستی می‌کند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بیگمان سرپرست من خدائی است که این کتاب (قرآن را بر من) نازل کرده است، و او است که بندگان شایسته را یاری و سرپرستی می‌کند. [[«یَتَوَلَّی»: سرپرستی می‌کند. یاری می‌دهد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سرور من خداوند است که [این‌] کتاب آسمانی را فرو فرستاده است و او دوستدار شایستگان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی و سرپرست من، خدایی است که این کتاب را نازل کرده؛ و او همه صالحان را سرپرستی می‌کند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا یار (دوست و سرپرست و پشتیبان) من خداوندی است که فرستاد کتاب را و او است سرپرست شایستگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا دوست و سرپرست من خداى يكتاست كه [اين‌] كتاب را فروفرستاد و او نيكان و شايستگان را سرپرستى و كارسازى مى‌كند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «بی‌گمان سرور من خدایی است که قرآن را فرستاد و او شایستگان را سروری و پشتیبانی می‌کند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: My saviour is God who has revealed this Book; and He protects those who are upright;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Indeed my Protector is Allah Who has sent down the Book; and He befriends the righteous.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: My Protector is God who sent down the Book, and He takes into His protection the righteous.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily my protector is Allah who hath revealed the Book, and He protecteth the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Verily, my Wali (Protector, Supporter, and Helper, etc.) is Allah Who has revealed the Book (the Quran), and He protects (supports and helps) the righteous.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “My Master is God, He Who sent down the Book, and He takes care of the righteous.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: My guardian is Allah Who has revealed the Book, and it is He Who protects the righteous.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, my protector is Allah Who has revealed the Book (the Qur'an), and He protects the righteous.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! my Protecting Friend is Allah Who revealeth the Scripture. He befriendeth the righteous.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: My guardian is indeed Allah who sent down the Book, and He takes care of the righteous.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: My Guardian is Allah, who has sent down the Book. He guards the righteous.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, my protector is Allah, who has sent down the Book; and He is an ally to the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The (true) Guardian is certainly God who has revealed the Book and is the Guardian of the righteous ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely my guardian is Allah, Who revealed the Book, and He befriends the good.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna waliyyiya Allahu allathee nazzala alkitaba wahuwa yatawalla alssaliheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: My protector is God who sent down the Book, for it is He who protects the righteous.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "For my Protector is Allah, Who revealed the Book (from time to time), and He will choose and befriend the righteous.

verses.text: وَ الَّذِينَ‌ تَدْعُونَ‌ مِنْ‌ دُونِهِ‌ لاَ يَسْتَطِيعُونَ‌ نَصْرَکُمْ‌ وَ لاَ أَنْفُسَهُمْ‌ يَنْصُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و کسانی را که به جای خدا می خوانید، نه می توانند شما را یاری دهند و نه خود را یاری رسانند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنان را كه به جاى اللّه به خدايى مى‌خوانيد، نه شما را مى‌توانند يارى كنند و نه خود را.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و كسانى را كه به جاى او مى‌خوانيد، نه مى‌توانند شما را نصرت دهند و نه خودشان را يارى كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و كسانى را كه به جاى او مى‌خوانيد، نمى‌توانند شما را يارى كنند و نه خويشتن را يارى دهند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آنهایی را که شما خدا می‌خوانید جز خدای یکتا هیچ یک قدرت بر یاری شما بلکه بر یاری خود ندارند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چیزهائی را که شما بجز خدا فریاد می‌دارید و می‌پرستید، نه می‌توانند شما را یاری دهند و نه می‌توانند خویشتن را کمک کنند.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و کسانی که در برابر و به جای او [خداوند] می‌خوانید، نمی‌توانند به شما و نه به خودشان یاری‌ای برسانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آنهایی را که جز او می‌خوانید، نمی‌توانند یاریتان کنند، و نه (حتی) خودشان را یاری دهند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آنان را که جز او خوانید نتوانند شما را یاری‌کردن و نه خویشتن را یاری کنند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنان كه به جاى او مى‌خوانيد- بُتها- نه مى‌توانند شما را يارى كنند و نه خود را يارى مى‌كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و کسانی را که بجز او می‌خوانید، نتوانند شما را کمک کنند و نه خودشان را کمک می‌کنند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: While those you beseech apart from Him cannot help you or even help themselves.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And those whom you worship besides Him cannot help you nor do they help themselves.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And those on whom you call, apart from God, have no power to help you, neither they help themselves.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And those whom ye call upon be side Him cannot succour you nor them selves they can succour.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And those whom you call upon besides Him (Allah) cannot help you nor can they help themselves."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those you call upon besides Him cannot help you, nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And those whom you invoke other than Allah, they can neither help themselves nor you.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And those whom you call upon besides Him (Allah) cannot help you nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They on whom ye call beside Him have no power to help you, nor can they help you, nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Those whom you invoke besides Him can neither help you, nor help themselves.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Those whom you invoke, other than Him, cannot help you, nor can they help themselves'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And those you call upon besides Him are unable to help you, nor can they help themselves."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The idols which you (the pagans) worship besides God can neither help you nor themselves.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And those whom you call upon besides Him are not able to help you, nor can they help themselves.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waallatheena tadAAoona min doonihi la yastateeAAoona nasrakum wala anfusahum yansuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Those whom you call on besides Him have no power to help you, nor can they help themselves."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "But those ye call upon besides Him, are unable to help you, and indeed to help themselves."

verses.text: وَ إِنْ‌ تَدْعُوهُمْ‌ إِلَى‌ الْهُدَى‌ لاَ يَسْمَعُوا وَ تَرَاهُمْ‌ يَنْظُرُونَ‌ إِلَيْکَ‌ وَ هُمْ‌ لاَ يُبْصِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر آنان را به سوی هدایت دعوت کنید، نمی شنوند و آنان را می بینی که به سوی تو می نگرند در حالی که نمی بینند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اگر آنها را به راه هدايت بخوانى نمى‌شنوند و مى‌بينى كه به تو مى‌نگرند ولى گويى كه نمى‌بينند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر آنها را به هدايت بخوانيد نمى‌شنوند، و مى‌بينى [مانند مجسمه‌] به سوى تو مى‌نگرند ولى نمى‌بينند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر آنها را به [راه‌] هدايت فرا خوانيد، نمى‌شنوند، و آنها را مى‌بينى كه به سوى تو مى‌نگرند در حالى كه نمى‌بينند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر آنها را به راه هدایت خوانید نخواهند شنید (یعنی بتان چون گوش و بت‌پرستان چون هوش ندارند دعوت اسلام را نپذیرند. و ای رسول ما یا ای اهل عقل و بینش) تو می‌بینی که آنها (بتان یا بت‌پرستان) در تو می‌نگرند ولی نمی‌بینند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و اگر از آنها رهنمود بخواهید، درخواست شما را نمی‌شنوند (چه رسد به این که شما را ارشاد و راهنمائی کنند. و به ظاهر پیکره‌ی) آنها را می‌بینید که (انگار با چشمان خود) به شما می‌نگرند، ولیکن چیزی را نمی‌بینند. [[«وَ إِن تَدْعُوهُمْ ...»: (نگا: اعراف. 193).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر ایشان را به [راه‌] هدایت بخوانید نمی‌شنوند و می‌نگریشان که به سوی تو می‌نگرند ولی نمی‌بینند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اگر آنها را به هدایت فرا خوانید، سخنانتان را نمی‌شنوند! و آنها را می‌بینی (که با چشمهای مصنوعیشان) به تو نگاه می‌کنند، اما در حقیقت نمی‌بینند!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر خوانیشان بسوی هدایت نشنوند و بینیشان می‌نگرند بسوی تو و لیکن نمی‌بینند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر آنها را به راه راست بخوانيد نمى‌شنوند، و مى‌بينى كه به تو مى‌نگرند و حال آنكه نمى‌بينند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و اگر آنها را به راه راست فرا خوانید، نمی‌شنوند و آنها را می‌بینی که سوی تو می‌نگرند در حالی که نمی‌بینند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When you call upon them for guidance, they do not hear. When you think they are looking at you, (in fact) they cannot see."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And if you call them to guidance they do not listen; and you (Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) observe them looking towards you, whereas they do not perceive anything.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: If you call them to the guidance they do not hear; and thou seest them looking at thee, unperceiving.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And if ye Call them towards guidance they will not hear and thou wilt behold them looking at thee, but they see not.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And if you call them to guidance, they hear not and you will see them looking at you, yet they see not.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And if you call them to guidance, they will not hear. And you see them looking at you, yet they do not see.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And if you were to call them to true guidance, they will not hear; and you observe them looking at you whereas they have no power to see.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And if you call them to guidance, they hear not and you will see them looking at you, yet they see not."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And if ye (Muslims) call them to the guidance they hear not; and thou (Muhammad) seest them looking toward thee, but they see not.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: If you call them to guidance, they will not hear. You see them facing you, but they do not see.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: If you call them to guidance, they will not hear you. You see them looking towards you, but they cannot see.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And if you invite them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you while they do not see.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), if you invite them to the right guidance, they will not listen to you. You will see them looking at you but they do not really see.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And if you invite them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking towards you, yet they do not see.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wain tadAAoohum ila alhuda la yasmaAAoo watarahum yanthuroona ilayka wahum la yubsiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: If you call them to the right path, they will not hear you. You find them looking towards you, but they do not see you.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: If thou callest them to guidance, they hear not. Thou wilt see them looking at thee, but they see not.

verses.text: خُذِ الْعَفْوَ وَ أْمُرْ بِالْعُرْفِ‌ وَ أَعْرِضْ‌ عَنِ‌ الْجَاهِلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: عفو و گذشت را پیشه کن، و به کار پسندیده فرمان ده، و از نادانان روی بگردان.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: عفو را پيشه كن و به نيكى فرمان ده و از جاهلان اعراض كن.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: عفو را پيشه كن و به نيكى فرمان ده و از نادان‌ها رخ برتاب

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گذشت پيشه كن، و به [كار] پسنديده فرمان ده، و از نادانان رخ برتاب.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
